She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell at her buying and selling rice grain business.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years. Helen earns additional income from raising livestock.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rozilmo

texts.ru: Розилмо является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем, 56 лет и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает  учителем в средней школе  и получает маленькую зарплату. Ее старшие дети тоже работают, но их доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Розилмо решила помочь мужу и детям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей овощей на местном рынке, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей и внуков с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rozilmo is one of these individuals who try to improve living conditions and stimulate the economic conditions of their family. She is married, 56 years old, and she is raising three children. Her husband works as a teacher in high school and receives a small pay. Her oldest children also work, but their income is not sufficient to provide the family with all necessary means. 

Rozilmo decided to help her husband and children for the family's benefit. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association for Business Women, and she received a certificate. Now she may start her own business and become successful in this area. 

Rozilmo would like to set up a business of buying and selling vegetables at the local market, as she has experience in this type of business. She plans to use the income received to provide her children and grandchildren with a good education and hearty food. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni for the purchase of food products in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for setting up a business

loans.name: Jose Ilerman

texts.es:
José, vive con sus dos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad, estos hijos los cuida solo él ya que quedaron a su responsabilidad, él administra un cyber café, tambien el negocio de fotografías al minuto, atiende todos los días, lo tiene en un lugar propio, su ubicación es adecuada, porque esta cerda de un centro escolar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de accesorios para computadora (mause, teclados), realizara remodelación de la sala de foto estudio, en estas dos actividades esta compartida la inversión del préstamo,  el préstamo será un aporte necesario ya que se acercan las graduaciones de los estudiantes y hay más demanda de fotografías, al igual la demanda en el Cyber.
Su aspiración es tener más clientes, ofrecer un buen servicio, incrementar sus ganancias ya que así podrá ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José lives with his 2 children who are 7 and 12 years old. He cares for these children alone as they were left in his care. He runs an internet cafe. He also attends to his photography business every dat. He has it in his own place. Its location is adequate, because it is close to the school center.
He is requesting a loan to purchase computer accessories (mouse, keyboards). He will also remodel his photo studio. These two activities make up the investment of the loan. The loan will be will be necessary assistance as student graduations are already approaching and there is more demand for photos, as well as demand in the internet cafe.
His aspiration is to have more clients, offer a good service, and grow his income so that he will be able to help his children.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories: mouse, keyboards.

loans.name: Santos Matilde

texts.es:
El señor Santos Matilde esta soltero, tiene 19 años de edad, estudio los estudio de secundaria con profesión maestra de educacion, pero no tiene trabajo en su campo de profesión, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio aprendiendo con sus padres, hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores para hacer tejidos y poderlos vender para tener ganancias, espera ser un buen administrador de su negocio y tener empleados.
texts.en:
Santos Matilde is single, 19, and in secondary school studied teaching as a profession, but he does not work in his professional field. He works weaving typical cuts of fabric. He began by learning with his parents, and so far he has four years of experience.

He is requesting the loan to be used to purchase different colors of yarn to make weavings and be able to sell them to make a profit. He hopes to be a good business administrator and have employees.

loans.use: to buy yarn for weaving

loans.name: Ruben Alonso

texts.es:
Rubén  originario de la comarca Rio Coco, en  las afueras de Estelí, casado, padre de 3 hijos, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de banano. Rubén inicio con capital propio, el cual compro una camioneta con el dinero que tenía ahorrado, que  le sirve como un medio de transporte para vender sus productos que comercializa en la misma comarca donde habita, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, este ha sido su primer negocio, con el que mantiene a su familia. 
 Rubén  solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumo como abonos, fertilizantes para sembrar  banano y  comprar granos básicos para diversificar, ya que el estima que le ayudaría a comprar más productos de calidad  para ofrecerle a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es invertir más en su venta de granos básicos, ya que esto le ayudaría a incrementar sus ganancias, siempre impulsar la siembra de banano y café. Su meta en la vida es poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén originates from the Rio Coco district on the outskirts of Estelí. He is married and is the father of three children. He dedicates himself to growing bananas in the agricultural trade. Rubén began with his own capital - a van which he bought with money he had saved. It serves him as a means of transportation to sell his products, which he commercializes in the same district where he lives. He counts on the support of his wife. This has been his first business and it provides for his family.

Rubén is asking for the loan to buy supplies like fertilizers to grow bananas and to buy basic grains to diversify, as he believes it would help him to buy more quality products to offer his clients. His future plans are to invest more in his sales of basic grains because this would help him increase his income by boosting the growth of bananas and coffee. His goal in life it to be able to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers to grow bananas and to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Rosamyrna

texts.en:
Rosamyrna is a 62-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store. This is the source of her income.

Rosamyrna is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as dry goods, canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, etc. Through this loan, she could improve her sales and profit.

In the future, Rosamyrna wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as dry goods, canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 45-year-old illiterate woman who looks after her family of 5. 

Being an illiterate woman has not given her a lot of chances to find jobs that could help in supporting the family, so she started a small retail business at home, selling blankets that she gets from wholesale markets.  

Asmahan has applied for this loan in order to get more blankets and bed covers to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: to get more blankets and bed covers to resell.

loans.name: Frenny Pearl

texts.en:
Frenny Pearl is 20 years old, married with one child. 

Frenny Pearl is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. Frenny Pearl requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Frenny Pearl has been hog-raising for two years and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Frenny Pearl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married lady, 23 years old, with 3 children ages 6, 3 and 3 months.  She has been running a retail shop for seven years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.  

She has obtained a loan of KES. 45,000 from KADET LTD; this is her second loan.  After successfully repaying the previous loan, she wishes to purchase fresh bread, sugar, salt, and washing soaps to sell.

The profits earned will be used to improve the living standards of her family. She hopes for a better living.

loans.use: To purchase fresh bread, sugar, salt, and washing soaps for her retail shop.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been a seamstress for 10 years. It was very difficult for her to feed her children when her husband was struggling hard to earn bread and butter for his family. Razia’s husband could not earn enough to survive as he is employed as a security guard. This compelled her to start stitching for the people living in her community. She works hard both day and night to make her work famous so she may be able to provide food for her family. Owing to the good quality of her work, she receives many orders from her customers on a regular basis. To complete her orders on time she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase raw materials, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. This will improve her earnings and enable her to better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than two years now.

Lucille hopes to make her business a success. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and also feed for the pigs. With this loan, Lucille will be able to grow healthy pigs.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and also feed for the pigs

loans.name: Shefa

texts.en:
Shefa is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and four daughters. Her husband works in a barber shop in the village where they live. His low salary is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

For the past two years, Shefa has had a small sewing workshop in her house where she sews clothes for customers. This has been a profitable project, but it needs additional support to cover the cost of new equipment.

Shefa is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new sewing machine to provide better quality to her loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Shefa's income, so that she will live with her family in better conditions.

Shefa is pictured here while she is sewing clothes.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nyamhuu

texts.en: Mr. Nyamhuu is 36 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His 32-year-old wife, Tsetsegmaa, works with him in their cattle farm. His 2 children, Damdinsharav and Avirmed, ages 6 and 3, stay home with their grandparents during the day. He started his business of cattle farming and producing and selling organic dairy products in 2008. He has been producing and providing organic dairy products to local customers, and he is famous in the area for his organic dairy products. He is preparing for the harsh Mongolian winter by purchasing forage for his cattle to keep the dairy product production going during the winter. He is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase bulk forage to feed his cattle during the harsh cold winter of Mongolia. He is a hardworking and optimistic person.

loans.use: to purchase bulk forage to feed his cattle during the harsh cold winter of Mongolia.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.ru: Сауда молодая и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 18 лет, не замужем и живет с родителями. Она шьет очень красивые женские платья и планирует использовать свое ремесло для получения дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3800 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sauda is a young and purposeful woman. She is 18 years old, not married, and she lives with her parents. She sews very beautiful women's dresses and plans to use this craft for receiving income. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Now she may start her own business and become successful in this area. 

Sauda would like to organize a business of sewing women's clothing, as she has experience in this type of business. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,800 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine, in order to organize her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for setting up a business

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe tiene la edad de 64 años de edad, soltero, padre de 2 hijos, entre las edades de 12 y 15 años respectivamente, de oficio carpintero, con conocimientos. Él dice  que inicio trabajando desde muy pequeño en carpintería, y luego con las ganancias que obtuvo de su trabajo, comenzó a comprar herramientas, y fue allí que decidió poner su propio taller de carpintería, para independizarse. Él no cuenta con otros ingresos solo los que le genera su negocio, de esta manera le gustaría dar a conocer  sus muebles como mesas, gabinetes, roperos, y sillas en las casas comerciales de otros departamentos, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio y promover sus conocimientos en muebles, para ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de calidad.
Felipe está solicitando el crédito para comprar toda la materia prima que necesita como madera,  pintura, lija, barniz y pegamento etc. ya que el estima que le ayudaría en poder comprar todos los materiales que necesita en su taller, para la elaboración de sus muebles, sus planes futuros es ampliar y mejorar su taller para tener mejor oportunidad crecimiento en su negocio.
texts.en:
Felipe is 46 years old, single, and the father of two children who are 12 and 15 years old respectively. He works as an experienced carpenter by trade. He says he began his work in carpentry when he was very little, and later began to buy tools with the earnings he gained from his work. This was how he decided to make his own carpentry workshop and become independent. He does not have other income, only what his business generates, so he would like to publicize his furniture such as tables, cabinets, wardrobes, and seats in commercial houses from other areas. His expectation is to continue developing his business and to promote his knowledge of furniture to offer his clients a quality product. 

Felipe is asking for this loan to buy all of the raw materials he needs, such as  wood, paint, sandpaper, varnish, glue, etc. He believes this will help him be able to buy all of the materials he needs in his workshop to produce his furniture. His future plans are to expand and improve his workshop to have a better opportunity for expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials: wood, paint, sandpaper, varnish, glue, etc.

loans.name: Irma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Irma originaria de Estelí, con 52 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, de oficio comerciante. Ella cuenta que inicio con capital propio, dinero que obtuvo vendiendo nacatamal y verduras, luego con el dinero que fue ahorrando, decidió poner su propio negocio. Actualmente  es dueña de una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace 2 años. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, le gustaría comercializar sus productos en  el mismo vecindario, su expectativa es  incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias.
Irma está solicitando el préstamo para comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, snacks, etc. Ya que su objetivo es incrementar sus ventas al tener más productos en inventarios y poder ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, sus planes futuros son ampliar su pulpería para obtener mayores ganancias y   poder comprar una vitrina en donde pueda  exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Irma is a native of Estelí.  She is 52 years old, the mother of four children and a retailer.  She says that she started her business with her own capital, which she earned selling "nacatamal" (steamed meat and vegetable pasty, cooked in banana or maize leaves) and vegetables.  With the money that she saved, she decided to open her own business.  She is currently the owner of a small grocery, which she has run for the last two years.  Irma has her husband's support.  She would like to sell her products in her neighborhood.  She expects to increase her sales and earn a better income. 
Irma is requesting the loan in order to purchase basic food items like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oils, snacks, etc.  Since her objective is to increase her sales once she has more products in her inventory and to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, her future plans are to expand her grocery to earn a larger income and to purchase a display case for her products.

loans.use: to purchase basic food items like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Santos Delfino

texts.es:
El señor Santos Delfino esta casado, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, curso los estudios de secundaria, como maestro de música, lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es locutora de radio.

Solicita un préstamo para pagar un teclado musical que va comprar, para poder atender mejor en su academia de música, espera seguir superándose en su profesión y en el futuro trabajar para una empresa grande de música.
texts.en:
Santos Delfino is married, 33 years old, and has four children, two of whom are studying in high school. He is a music teacher with five years of experience and the support of his wife, who is a radio announcer.

His is asking for a loan to pay for a musical keyboard that he is going to buy so he will be able to better attend to his music academy. He hopes to continue rising in his profession and to work with a big music business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a musical keyboard

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is 31 years old and she is from the small village of Kaspi district.

Juna lives with her husband and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have pigs. Juna is involved in meat trading. She buys cows, slaughters them, and then sells the meat in the nearby villages. 

Juna is a very hardworking, responsible person with a lot of experience in this business. She requested a loan for purchasing additional cows. After buying additional cows, she will expand her meat business. She will purchase more cows and sell more meat at a good price. She will increase her trade capital and make her business more profitable. With this plan, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for slaughtering.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man aged 32 who supports a family of 3 members. His two children are aged 11 and five years old. He practices dairy farming and has been in operation for a period of 13 years, earning an income of KES 12,000.

He has borrowed his seventh loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully and intends to purchase a dairy cow.  

The anticipated profits will be used to plough back to his dairy farm. He hopes for prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: After getting her previous loan, Manal bought more clothing items and started selling school stationery and toys for kids. Her husband helps her in distributing the goods when someone asks for a specific order. Today she has applied for another loan, in order to increase the quantity of goods she has for sale.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods she has for sale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 46 years old, married, and has two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF, to buy items like rice and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like rice and other groceries, to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 30 years old. He is married and has four children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, cassava and bananas. They also have cows, goats and sheep. 

Amos looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Amos will pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being able to have the capital and expertise to have the best breeds of animals on his farm.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from the Martvili district. She is 42 years old, a single woman who lives with her cousin. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. 

Nana owns three greenhouses where dahlias are grown. Nana has her own store in the center of the village and sells dahlias locally. In addition, the family runs a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market.

Nana requested a loan to purchase rose saplings to grow in her greenhouse, as roses are very popular and the demand is high. Nana will sell the harvested roses in her store; this will increase the monthly income of the family. 

With the increased income, Nana will improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase rose saplings for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Achilles

texts.en:
Achilles is 27 years old and has one child. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, and groundnuts. He keeps cows, goats, and chickens. He also has a small shop where he sells household commodities.

Achilles looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Achilles will save for the animal pharmaceutical shop that he would like to open in his village. He will also pay school fees for his child. His biggest dream is to own land where he will build an apartment building.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 29 years old and has one child. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, cassava, and bananas. He also keeps cows and goats.

Abel looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Abel will save money so that he can go back to school. He dreams of becoming an electrical engineer.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old, married, and has five children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, coffee, and cassava. They also have cows, goats, sheep, pigs, and chickens. 

Moses looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Moses will buy more pigs. He dreams of improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
After receiving her previous loan, Sawsan bought more beads and fabric and started making new items, such as wall hangings, other than embroidering clothes. She used the same process in making the clothes in making hanging walls using threads and beads. 

Sawsan is requesting another loan to buy more colorful beads in different sizes and shapes and some colorful fabric.

loans.use: to purchase more colorful beads.

loans.name: Mustafah

texts.en:
Mustafah is 21 years old and has two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans,, and other vegetables. He also keeps goats and pigs. 

Mustafah looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Mustafah will save to buy more pigs and will also pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream is for his children to receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a poultry business where she sells eggs and chickens. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. In addition, Pamela sells vegetables and fruits to customers, which increases her business income.

Pamela is requesting her second loan from SMEP DTM for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy chickens to sell.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of chickens.  Her business goal is to improve her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафизе  20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она очень целеустремленная и трудолюбивая девушка. Она умеет шить женские одежды и хочет использовать свое ремесло для получения дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес услугой портнихи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hafiza is 20 years old. She is not married, and she lives with her parents. She is a very purposeful and hard working young woman. She knows how to sew women's clothing and would like to use her craft for receiving an income. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Now she may set up her own business and become successful in this area. 

Hafiza would like to set up a business, providing a dressmaking service. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for setting up a business

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Малика открыла аптеку в районе Зафаробод. Она фармацевт по специальности. В этой области Малика работает два года. Она берет кредит для приобретения антибиотиков и других необходимых противовоспалительных препаратов.
texts.en:
Malika is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. She is 28 years old and married. She has three children. 

Malika opened a pharmacy in the region of Zafarobod. She is a pharmacist by profession. Malika has worked in this area for two years. She takes a loan for the purchase of antibiotics and other necessary anti-inflammatory drugs.

loans.use: to purchase antibiotics and other necessary anti-inflammatory drugs

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо проживает в районе Зафаробод, недалеко от города Истаравшан. Ей 33 года. Она живет с матерью, отцом и сестрой. Мархабо занимается скотоводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Мархабо берет кредит для закупа бычков и коров.
texts.en:
Marhabo lives in the region Zafarobod, not far from the city of Istaravshan. She is 33 years old. She lives with her mother, father and sister. 

Marhabo is engaged in livestock breeding. She breeds cattle for selling. She has been engaged in this type of activity for five years. Marhabo takes a loan for the purchase of bulls and cows.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and cows

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Ana es acompañada tiene cinco hijos menores los que están en edad escolar a los que tiene el deber de mantener los estudios, se dedica a su negocio en el mercado de Chinandega en el sector madera desde hace 25 años.
Desde que inicio el negocio la señora  se ha caracterizado por ser una señora muy luchadora y emprendedora ya que su negocio lo inicio con poca mercadería y con mucho esfuerzo  ha salido adelante manteniendo su núcleo familiar, una de las dificultades que atraviesa la señora  es comprar mercadería para su negocio como artesanía en general, batellas, tajaderos es por eso que llego a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento que le permita comprar la mercadería y poder mantener los ingresos los cuales le ayudan a mantener su núcleo familiar  y la educación de sus hijos.
Cabe señalar que la señora  desde que trabaja con Ceprodel su negocio ha incrementado bastante  y su calidad de vida ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Ana has five young, school-aged children, and has the duty of providing for their studies. She has dedicated herself to her business in the wood sector of the Chinandega market for the past 25 years.

Since she began her business, she has been characterized as a fighter of a woman as well as enterprising because she began her business with little merchandise and a lot of effort. She has managed to move forward and to support her core family. One of the difficulties she faces is buying merchandise for her business, such as general artisanry, small boats, and pitchers. For this reason, she came Ceprodel to receive financing that permits her to buy merchandise and be able to maintain her income which supports her family and her children's education.

It should be noted that since working with Ceprodel, her business has grown quite a bit and her quality of life has improved.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business like small boats, pitchers, and artisanry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a loom

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: This time, unlike her past four years, Rosalina is applying for a loan of Php 16000 to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF,  Kiva's partner, continues and helps Rosalina and her family to increase income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолату 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Все ее дети совершеннолетние. Ее муж занимается переработкой железы. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 12 лет назад Адолат начала свой бизнес куплей продажей индустриальных товаров. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. Она должна купить товар для расширения ассортимента, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони  для покупки товара. Она ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ей поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en:
Adolat is 47 years old. She is married and raising four children. All her children are adults. Her husband works with processing iron. With an aim to provide the family with all necessary means, Adolat started her business of buying and selling industrial goods 12 years ago. She sells her goods at the local market and has a large customer base.

Adolat needs to purchase goods for expanding the assortment, but does not have sufficient funds for this. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni for the purchase of goods. She awaits your kindness. Come on, let's help her keep her advantage!

loans.use: To purchase industrial goods for widening her assortment of goods

loans.name: La Reforma 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Elicia is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma (Reform) 1, 2 & 3. She has a long-term partner and is a mother with five children, all of whom live with her in a simply structured home. They live in the rural village of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activity here is the free-trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.

Elicia has been selling used clothes for approximately 8 years. She used some money she had to start the business. She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes (she buys bags of used clothes in a flea market). She will reinvest the profits in her business so she can expand her sales and supply more clients. This is her 9th loan with Esperanza International, and she is very excited about it. She has been investing all of her loans in her business. Elicia thanks you all for your support of her group's dreams.

loans.use: To buy various bags of used clothes

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Petronila esta soltera, tiene 18 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría, aprendió este trabajo con al apoyo de su hermana mayor, y hasta ahora lleva 5 años de experiencia, ya que desde niña ha estado trabajando, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varias clases y también de seda, ya que quiere tener la producción de cortes de seda, y ofrecer nuevos diseños a sus cliente, espera contar con su propio capital y poder incrementado.
texts.en:
18-year old Sra. Petronila is single. She didn't have the chance to go to school. She is a weaver, having learned this skill with help from her older sister. Petronila now has five years of experience as a weaver. Her parents help support her.

She is seeking a loan to buy different types of thread and silk since she wishes to make silk cloth and offer new designs to her customers. She hopes to have her own working capital and to be able to increase it.

loans.use: To buy thread to make fabric

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora es trabajadora de la alcaldía desde hace 7 años, trabaja en el barrido de calles en horas de madrugada es casada tiene dos hijos quienes están estudiando.

La señora  solicita el financiamiento para compra de materiales de construcción para componer el poche de su casa.
texts.en:
Digna has been a hard worker in the mayor's office for the past seven years. She works sweeping the streets at dawn and is married with two children who are studying.

She is asking for financing to buy construction materials to arrange on her house's porch.

loans.use: to buy ceramics to put on her house porch.

loans.name: Monica Oralee

texts.es:
La señora trabaja para el ministerio de educación desde hace 12 años, está ubicada en una de las escuelas de primaria del reparto la florida en Chinandega, es casada tiene dos niños a su cargo quienes están en edad escolar.

La clienta imparte clase en el turno de la tarde desde la una de la tarde hasta las cinco de la tarde. En la foto que le tomamos aparece ella de pies dándole orientaciones a sus alumnos.

La señora solicitaba el financiamiento para compra de materiales de construcción para terminar un cuarto que le quedo a media.
texts.en:
Sra. Monica has worked for the Ministry of Education for 12 years in one of the primary schools located in Chinandega, in the residential neighbourhood of La Florida. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Monica teaches the afternoon session, from 1pm to 5pm. In the photo she can be seen standing in front of her students giving them directions.

She is seeking a loan to buy building materials to complete a room which is only half-finished.

loans.use: To buy building material

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es: El señor  es trabajador de la alcaldía desde hace 2 años  trabaja como guarda de seguridad  tiene dos niños a quien mantener. Su solicitud es para compra de materiales de construcción como zinc ya que deseaba cambiarle el techo a su cuarto.
texts.en:
The gentleman has been working as a security guard for the town hall for the past 2 years.
He has two children to support. He is requesting a loan to purchase building materials such as zinc, as he would like to change his bedroom's roof.

loans.use: to purchase zinc for his house

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Thakurani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Renubala is 38 years old, married and has two children who are studying in school. She lives in the village of Bbalugaon of Odisha, India. Renubala is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business farming her paddy and selling her crops in the market in Khurda district in Odisha, India. She already has had this business for four years and it is going very well. At this time, Renubala is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands.
 
This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the Maa Laxmi Thakurani Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Renubala as their president. The lady sitting third from left in the first row in the photo wearing a blue and white colored sari is Renubala. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and tools for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anita is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 45 years old, married and a father of one child. He is in the dairy industry and depends on the dairy products for the family's upkeep. Alex has been in this business for the last 12 years.

Alex in borrowing his fourth loan from KADET LTD to finance his business and with the money he plans to purchase another cow and more dairy feed. 

He intends to grow his business even further and increase his dairy milk supply in Kilifi and Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase another cow and more dairy feed

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú!, El grupo “EL EDEN” está conformado por 10 personas que se caracterizan por ser perseverantes, luchadores y así sigan adelante en todos sus proyectos. La Sra. Maritza es aquella mujer que sale abrazando con efusividad a sus compañeras y viste una chompa color fucsia. Ella tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad. Maritza se dedica diariamente a la venta de productos de abarrotes en su pequeña “Bodega”; El préstamo  lo utilizara para comprar mercadería, por la fuerte demanda que tiene su negocio y también lo utilizara en algunos gastos personales de prioridad. La Sra. Maritza al igual que el grupo "El Eden" agradece a todas aquellas personas que por  medio de KIVA y EDAPROSPO ayudan a hacer realidad sus metas.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru! The group “El Eden” is made up of 10 people who are characterized as being persevering, fighters and in that way they move forward with all their projects.  Maritza is the woman that is effusively hugging her colleagues and is wearing a fuchsia sweater.  She is 42 years old and has 3 adult children.  Martiza earns a living by selling groceries in her small shop.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise because her business has high demand and also she will use it for some high priority personal expenses.  Maritza, like all members of the group “El Eden”, thanks all of the people that, through Kiva and EDAPROSPO, have helped her reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité Natividad de Maria son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo,  son 15 integrantes  muy responsables que se unieron con el propósito de trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo de todas.
Ninfa es la presidenta de este grupo y cuenta que tiene una pequeña peluquería en la que trabaja arduamente todos los días. Ella se ha hecho de buena fama con sus clientes, ya que siempre hace muy buenos servicios, y es gracias a ello que está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de spray, gel, tintes, shampoo y enjuagues para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
All the members of the Natividad de Maria group are from the San Lorenzo area. Each of the fifteen members is very responsible. They formed the group in order to work together and help each other.

Ninfa is the president of the group. She runs a small hair salon in which she works hard every day. She has a very good reputation amongst her clients as she always gives good service. Her client base is growing.

Ninfa is seeking a loan to buy hairspray, gel, dyes, shampoo, and rinses so she can continue serving her clients well.

loans.use: buy hairspray, gel, dyes, shampoo, and rinses

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is 46 years old, married, and has three children. After her husband retired he started investing in his own farm to earn income in addition to his retirement salary. Haneen is well known for her delicious pickles. She makes different types of pickles from cucumber, garlic, eggplants, and olives to sell.

Haneen is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more containers and vegetables to increase her productivity. She wants to start selling to local restaurants.

loans.use: to puchase more food containers.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He operates a boutique, selling a variety of products such as clothing and beauty products. 

Saidi is requesting for a loan, which he will use to buy bales of clothing and cosmetics. With the loan, he can sell more products to different people who at times pre-order.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Quinindé es un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad. En varios sectores  de esta provincia, residen familias que se dedican a la agricultura, y muchas veces su esfuerzo no es valorado, pues las empresas pagan costos muy bajos por los frutos que sus tierras producen, sin embargo, el sustento siempre está presente. En esta ciudad reside María, una mujer de 41 años que tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio. Ella terminó la educación secundaria y el obstáculo más grande que ella ha atravesado es la migración de su esposo Héctor a España. La necesidad de una mejor calidad de vida, separó a esta familia pero el lazo que sembraron desde el principio, los ha mantenido unidos en medio de la distancia. 
María desde muy niña aprendió la actividad de la agricultura con varios frutos, hace 10 años emprendió esta actividad con su esposo y actualmente lo desarrolla sola con un poco de ayuda de sus hijos. Su experiencia en el negocio ha dado muy buenos resultados y cada vez ha incrementado el negocio con nuevos productos. Todos los días entre 8 y 10 horas alternadas con el cuidado y atención a sus hijos, María cuida los cultivos y prepara los que están listos para la venta, además atiende a sus clientes de la mejor forma posible para así entregar un valor agregado a esta actividad. El cacao es muy demandado en el sector por lo que María solicita un crédito para incrementar sus cultivos de este fruto que es muy apetecido internacionalmente. Fundación Alternativa fue en donde encontró el apoyo y la agilidad que necesitaba, además que la asesoría que le brindó el ejecutivo que le visitó personalmente, sirvió de mucho para que ella realice mejoras en varias áreas de su negocio. María espera que este crédito aporte al crecimiento de su negocio y por ende ella pueda obtener mayores utilidades que le permitan dar a sus hijos la educación profesional que ella no pudo obtener.
texts.en:
Quinindé is a district in the province of Esmeraldas that provides various products to cities in Ecuador like banana, cacao, coffee, African palm and products from the forest and commercial activity is also a daily way for the majority of the inhabitants to get ahead and even more so after the roads to get to town have been expanded which has permitted a lot of commercial traffic, especially on the weekends when all types of businessmen come to offer their products at the market to potential customers who are usually people from the countryside. 

Tourism has also been an important activity in this area because the ecosystem has a lot of different places to be visited like waterfalls, fresh water, and woods that have flowers and animals that surround the city. In various sectors of the province, there are families that work in agriculture and a lot of the time their work is not valued demonstrated by the fact that companies pay very low prices for the fruit of their labor, nevertheless, there is always food present. In the city where María lives, a woman who is 41 years old and has two children who go to high school. She herself finished secondary school and the biggest obstacle that she has faced is the migration of her husband Hector to Spain. The necessity to find a better quality of life separated this family but their bond remains strong, being formed from the beginning, and it is this bond that has kept them together despite being so far apart. 

 María, since she was very little, learned about the agricultural industry with various plants and 10 tears ago she undertook this activity with her husband but currently she has been developing their business on her own, with a little help from her children. Her experience in the business has given her very good results and every time she has expanded with new products. Every day between 8 and 10 hours, with the care and attention of her children, María,takes care of her fields and prepares those that are ready for market. She also tends to her clients in the best way possible in order to give a certain dignity to her work. 

 Cacao is a very demanding sector to work in and this is why María is applying for a loan to increase her production of this plant, that is desired internationally. It was with Fundación Alternativa where she found support that she needed as well as all the consultation she received from the executive that visited her personally and it really helped her to improve in various areas of her business. María hopes that this loan will support the growth of her business and that she will be able to earn more which will help her give her children the professional education that she was not able to get.

loans.use: purchase seeds and increase her cacao production.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.es: ¡Hola!, desde Perú. Leslie es una joven aguerrida y deseosa por querer seguir saliendo adelante en su vida, tanto en el aspecto personal y profesional. Ella tiene 20 años, es soltera y aún vive con sus padres; Leslie es estudiante de obstetricia y además es una de las que posee mejores calificaciones de su grupo. Ella trabaja en el área administrativa de su Universidad y maneja sus tiempos para trabajar, estudiar y poder ayudar en su hogar. El presente préstamo lo utilizara para comprar instrumentos de trabajo que requiere para poder seguir adelante en los cursos de su Universidad y poder pagar unas cuotas pendientes de su centro de formación. Ella nos dice “estar encarecidamente agradecida a todas aquellas personas que a través de KIVA y EDAPROSPO, la apoyan para poder ser una profesional de prestigio”.
texts.en: Hello from Peru! Leslie is a brave young woman, eager to continue moving forward in her life, as much in the personal as in the professional aspect.  She is 20 years old, single and still lives with her parents.  Leslie is an obstetrics student and is also the one in her group that has the best grades.  She works in the administrative area of her university and manages her time to work, study and to be able to help at home.  The current loan will be used to buy work instruments that are required to continue the courses at her university and to be able to pay the outstanding installments to her training center.  She tells us she is earnestly grateful for all the people that, through Kiva and EDAPROSPO, support her to be able to become a prestigious professional.

loans.use: to buy work instruments and pay tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes del grupo mujeres alegres están trabajando para ir pasando los ciclos por medio del esfuerzo de todas. Ellas se unieron y están saliendo adelante ya que son muy trabajadoras y unidas.
La señora Florentina es la presidenta del comité, ella  cuenta con una cantina, donde vende todo tipo de productos, y es gracias a su pequeño negocio que puede ayudar a su familia con los ingresos que necesitan. La meta de Florentina es poder agrandar su negocio y tener mayores productos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, galletitas y demás, con los que podrá abastecer y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The 13 members of this group are happy women who are working to repay their loans through the hard work of everyone. They came together and are able to get ahead because they are hard working and united. 

Ms. Florentina is the President of the committee, she has a canteen where she sells all kinds of products and thanks to her small business, she has been able to help her family with the income they need. Ms. Florentina's goal is to be able to grow her business and to have more products. She is asking for a loan to purchase drinks, sweets, cookies and more which she will use to stock her store.

loans.use: purchase drinks, sweets, cookies and more.

loans.name: Angel Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Angel Maria es de la ciudad de Caacupé, son  12 mujeres que quieren salir adelante y trabajar juntas para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres es Rafaela, quien también es la presidenta de este grupo. Ella vende frutas, en especial todas aquellas que son de estación. Cuenta que esta saliendo adelante gracias a sus ventas, y que a su trabajo debe que su familia tenga todo y que nos les falte nada.
Solicita este crédito para poder comprar sandias, piñas, melones, manzanas y demás frutas de estación para poder seguir teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group Angel Maria is from the city of Caacupé and there are 12 women who want to get ahead and work together in order to help their families. One of these women is Rafaela who is also the President of this group. She sells fruit, especially those that are in season. She tells us that she is getting ahead thanks to her sales and that she works so that her family has everything and are never in need. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase watermelons, pineapples, melons, apples and more fruit that is in season in order to continue to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: purchase watermelons, pineapples, melons, apples and more fruit.

loans.name: Progreso Femenino Group

texts.es:
El grupo esta conformado por 12 mujeres, el comité se llama El progreso femenino, las señoras se reúnen semanalmente para pagar sus cuotas, se les realiza capacitaciones y pasan un buen momento entre vecinas.
Una persona muy humilde, pero sobre todo trabajadora es Martina, quien se dedica a la costura. Comenta que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y que eso le ayuda a hacerse de buena fama, y la ayuda a tener más clientes y así ir creciendo de a poco por medio de su trabajo. Martina sueña con tener un gran taller y también el día de mañana poder dar trabajo a personas que lo necesiten.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 12 women and the committee is named "El progreso femenino" (Woman's progress), the women meet weekly to pay their quotas and get training and have a good time among neighbors. 

One humble person, but also very hard working, is Martina, who is a seamstress. She comments that she has always done good work and that this has given her a good reputation and this has helped her have more customers and continue to grow her business little by little with her work. Martina dreams to have a bigger workshop and also in the future be able to hire people who need work. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase fabric, thread, elastics and other supplies in order to continue working on her orders.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread and more supplies.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 26 years old. He has two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, cassava and bananas. He also keeps cows, goats and sheep.
 
Patrick looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes. 
 
With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Patrick will invest in new animal breeds in order to increase the productivity of his farm. He dreams of opening a business that will help him to provide agricultural supplies to his village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Sondos

texts.en: Sondos is 38 years old and married. Her husband who supports the family is a mechanic. Sondos makes straw baskets and plastic flowers. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy raw materials to make more items from hay and straw such as table lampshades and mirror frames.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for straw baskets.

loans.name: Inversion Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Inversión” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de huevos, venta de jugos, helados y bebidas, venta de ropa interior, venta de accesorios para vehículos, venta de madera, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Maria, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal. Quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, Chaqueta de color café, de adorno usa un pañuelo en su cuello y usa una cartera de color café, su cabello es de color castaño y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, desde hace 40 años. Comenta que anteriormente trabajaba de puerta en puerta y en feria libres, y ahora arrendó un local donde lo inaugurara  y atenderá a su clientela de la manera que siempre ha soñado, tranquilamente y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
La mercadería e insumos  que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, donde encuentra gran variedad de articulos que ofrece en su bazar a bajo costo, por lo tanto convenientemente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará libros de cuentos, cuadernos, lápices de colores, adornos varios, calcetas, pañuelos, agendas, bolsas para regalos, zapatillas de lona, articulos entre otros.
Una de las metas de Maria es inaugurar pronto su bazar para recibir a su clientela y ofrecer toda su mercadería, lo que pida su clientela ella lo tendrá.
Maria tiene su pareja, pero viven en casas separadas. Sus sueños a nivel muy personal es tener una muerte linda y estar acompañada de sus seres queridos, y a nivel laboral crecer con su bazar y poder ayudar a gente que lo necesite, comenta que con las ventas que realiza, para la temporada de navidad confecciona 40 regalos que se los entrega a niños de escasos recursos que viven a su alrededor. 
Ella se siente contenta, agradecida y emocionada por el apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This community bank called “Inversion” [Investment] is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who earn a living in different areas including clothing sales, egg sales, sales of juices, ice cream and drinks, underwear sales, sales of vehicle accessories, wood sales, and services, among others.  All of the members are residents of the city of Valparaíso.  

Maria is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo, she is found seated in the first row, in the second place from right to left.  She is dressed in blue jeans and a brown jacket with a scarf around her neck and she has a brown purse.  Her hair is chestnut colored and she is wearing it down.  

She has earned a living selling various goods for the last 40 years.  She comments that she used to work door to door and in open air markets, but now she has rented a shop that she will open and she will attend to her customers in the way she has always dreamed of, calmly and satisfying the needs of her customers.  

She buys the merchandise and consumables that she needs in the city of Santiago, where she finds a large variety of articles that she offers in her shop at a low cost.  

With the loan, she will buy storybooks, notebooks, colored pencils, various decorations, socks, scarves, calendars, gift bags, and canvas sneakers among other items.  One of Maria’s goals is to open her shop soon in order to receive her customers and offer them all of her merchandise.  What they ask for, she will have.  

Maria has a partner, but they live in separate houses.  Her dream, on a personal level, is to die peacefully and pain-free, surrounded by her loved ones.  On a work level, her dream is to grow with her shop and to be able to help people that need it.  She comments that with the sales she makes, for the Christmas season, she will prepare 40 gifts that will be delivered to children with scarce resources that live in the surrounding area.  

She feels happy, grateful and excited for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza because it opened a door for her and allowed her to invest in her business and also her personal development as she has learned to organize and distribute her income and investments in a better way.  

Valparaiso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and is the seat of the country’s legislature.  It is the first port of the nation and it offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places like the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize, for example.

loans.use: to buy storybooks, notebooks, colored pencils, various decorations, socks, scarves, calendars, gift bags and canvas sneakers, among other items.

loans.name: Iris Suyapa

texts.es: Iris tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive con ellos y su esposo en un barrio de la comunidad de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace un año que ella decidió invertir sus ahorros en establecer una pulpería, la que ha surtido mediante la reinversión de sus ganancias. Ella vende productos alimenticios y abarrotes, como ser arroz, azúcar, manteca, churros, harina, productos enlatados, condimentos, papel higiénico, jabón, champú, colas y ganchos para cabello, etc. ahora ella ha decidido obtener un préstamo para tener variedad de productos que ofrecer a los clientes y poder crecer más. El préstamo es por 21,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, huevos, manteca, refrescos, lácteos, pan, churros, azúcar y otros abarrotes. Su meta es ser una buena empresaria y ayudar en lo que pueda a su familia y su mayor sueño es llegar a convertirse en un supermercado.
texts.en:
Iris is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a neighborhood in the community of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. One year ago, she decided to invest her savings in a convenience store and then reinvest her profits from the merchandise she sold. Iris sells food products and groceries such as rice, sugar, lard, snacks, flour, canned goods, condiments, toilet paper, soap, shampoo, hair clips, hairpins, and other items.

Iris has now decided to obtain a loan so that she can have a variety of products to offer to her customers in order to grow her business even more. The loan is in the amount of 21,000 HNL and will be used to purchase basic grains, eggs, lard, soft drinks, dairy products, bread, snacks, sugar, and other grocery items. Her goal is to become a good businesswoman and help her family as much as she can. Her greatest wish is to convert her business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, lard, soft drinks, dairy products, bread, snacks, sugar, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de una de las miembros,  quien se encontraba en otro comité, y decidió salir para formar uno dentro de su comunidad, y así poder ayudar también a sus amigas y vecinas de barrio. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el décimo tercer ciclo y quieren seguir creciendo.
La Sra Myrian, tiene 38 años esta casada con el Sr Carlos quien es empleado, juntos tienen 4 hijos, por quienes ambos luchan incansablemente para darles todo lo que necesitan y el día de mañana sean personas de bien. Myrian ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa, por medio de la venta de frutas de variadas clases, y solicita de este crédito para poder comprar frutas, como ser piñas, sandia, melones, bananas y demás, y así surtirse y tener buena variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The present committee was formed by the initiative of ones of its members, who was in another committee and decided to leave to form her own community and be able to help her friends and neighbors in her neighborhood. The committee is currently in its tenth repayment cycle and they want to continue growing.

Ms. Myrian is 38 years old, married to Mr. Carlos, who is employed, and together they have four children, for whom they work incessantly in order to give them what they need to be able to be successful people in the future. Myrian helps her husband with the household expenses by selling a variety of fruits and she is applying for this loan in order to purchase fruits such as pineapples, watermelons, melons, bananas and more and will be able to have a better selection for her customers.

loans.use: purchase pineapples, watermelons, melons, bananas and more.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El comité se formó en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Caaguazú, con 13 señoras humildes con el propósito de obtener una ayuda, ya que ellas desean una superación personal y laboral.
Benicia es un ejemplo de lucha, ya que ella todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas en su pequeña despensa. Comenta que de a poco está creciendo y agrandando su negocio y le ayuda mucho que siempre tiene todo lo que sus clientes necesitan.
Benicia solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, comestibles, bebidas y otros productos para tener bien surtido su local.
texts.en:
The group was formed in San Jose barrio, Caaguazu city, and includes 13 humble married women. Their proposal was to obtain financial aid because they desired personal and work advancement.

Benicia is an example of their struggle. Every day she begins work very early in the morning in her little store. She comments that starting with very little, her business is growing and aggrandizing and it helps a lot to always have what her customers need.

Benicia is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, fruit, groceries, drinks, and other products in order to re-stock her store.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, fruit, groceries, drinks, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is 26 years old. She earns her income through farming. She grows maize, beans, cassava, bananas, sweet potatoes and coffee. She also keeps cows, chickens, rabbits and pigs. 

Eve looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Eve will save money for a business that she would like to start. She dreams of building a house someday. She is very excited about this opportunity to help others in her village to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 25 years old. He is married and has one child. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans and cassava. They also have cows, goats, chickens, pigs and rabbits. 

John looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, John will invest in a tailoring business that he would like to start. He dreams of being a model farmer for his community and training them to be the best farmers that they can be, helping them to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 32 years old. He has three children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans and coffee. He also keeps cows, goats and chickens. 

Benard looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Benard will buy household necessities, such as paraffin for cooking. He dreams of seeing his children and younger brothers receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 42 years old and married to Lydia.  He sells second-hand clothes in Gikomba market in Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last 13 years and gets an income of KES50,500 per month.

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his seventh loan of KES 110,000, which he will use to buy three bales of second-hand clothes.

Henry plans to use his anticipated profit to buy more stock of clothes, such as skirts, blouses and children's clothes. He hopes to open many more stalls for clothes in the near future.

loans.use: To buy three bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 5 children whose ages range from 10 years to 24 years. She describes herself as a social and business-oriented woman. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

Mary's business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as being a shortage of charcoal to sell. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy bags of charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of charcoal within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of people. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Mary also sells cereals to add to her business income.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old. She is married and has five children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize, beans, coffee, cassava, sweet potatoes and mangoes. They also keep goats, chickens and pigs. 

Josephine looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Josephine will save up for two more cows. She dreams of being able to send her children to the best schools.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 36-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be a social and God-fearing woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells water and chickens. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a highly populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Joyce will use the 20,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy chickens to sell. Her business goal is to run a new business of a hotel within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 42 years old and lives in  Buchanan; she is married and has four children ranging in age from 16 to 20, all living at home and attending school. For the past 12 years, Edith has been selling fish in the market, a business she started with money given to her by her mother.

Edith is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to educate her children and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El Sr. Diego es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante está casado, tiene 2 hijos y trabaja en conjunto con su señora en su negocio hace más de cinco años, es una persona joven trabajadora y con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y dar a sus hijos lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
El Sr. Diego tiene una despensa bien surtida, y nos cuenta que su esposa lo ayuda siempre y de esa forma trabajan juntos y se ayudan. Ambos trabajan arduamente para poder dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener y de esa forma que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, enlatados, lácteos, carnes, embutidos y demás productos para poder surtir su local y seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
Diego is from the city of Pilar. He is a merchant. He is married with 2 children and has worked with his wife in his business for more than five years. He is a hard-working young person, and he has a great desire to continue growing and to give his children what they need for a dignified life.

Diego has a well-stocked store. He tells us that his wife always helps him, and in that way they work together and help each other. Both work hard in order to be able to give their children everything that they could not have so that tomorrow they will be good people.

He is asking for this loan to buy drinks, bread products, canned goods, milk products, meat, sausages, and other products in order to be able to stock his store and continue providing good variety to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, bread products, canned goods, milk products, meat, sausages, and other items

loans.name: Ybeth Gloria

texts.es:
Ybeth es una mujer de 26 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy humilde, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Ybeth pudo estudiar una carrera técnica, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Ybeth trabaja como promotora de ventas en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Ybeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de de una pequeña cocina y un refrigerador, los cuales le ahcen mucha falta en su hogar,ya que actualmente ella cuenta con una cocina a Kerosene que es muy peligroa y tiene temor que cuando se vaya a trabajar pueda ocurrir un accidente; de esta manera Ybeth pordrá conservar y preparar mejor sus alimentos,así pues Yebth seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ybeth is a 26 year old woman, is single and lives in the city of Ica. She is a very humble, hard working and enthusiastic person. She has a strong desire to get ahead. Thanks to her effort and her parents' support, Ybeth was able to study a technical career path. In her free time she likes to relax listening to music and on some occasions she cooks the delicious dish "arroz chaufa" to share with her family. 

With much perseverance and dedication, Ybeth works everyday as a sales promoter in a business within the city. She works from early in the morning and works up to eight hours a day. She is happy to work and believes that it is going well for her because of her responsible and the friendliness she shows her customers. 

Ybeth is very thankful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help brought she will be able to buy a small kitchenette and fridge, which she really needs and which will help her be able to conserve and better prepare her food. Currently her kitchen uses kerosene, which is very dangerous and she is afraid that when she goes to work there could be an accident. In this way she will continue working and putting in the effort to realize her goals and her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy a kitchenette and a fridge.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Mercedes   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Verónica estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Oficial de cobranzas en una Institución de ayuda social, en la ciudad de La Paz.
