Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Sujey Johanna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Solicita el crédito para comprar agroinsumos, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. 
  
Las compras y las  las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprarse una finca y una camioneta. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar basketh y el indor.

"Esta muy agradecido por el cedito anterior
texts.en:
Sujey Johanna is 32 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives with her children in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rìos province.

She is a member of the communal bank JERUSALEN, which is located in the Caimito region, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche parrish, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This solidarity group is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, rice, and Gandul bean planting.

Sujey Johanna has made a living planting corn and rice for five years. She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs, insecticides, urea, liquid herbicides, and fertilizers. With the help of the loan she can buy fertilizer for the crops. She will make these purchases in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rìos. The challenges she faces are plagues and bad weather.

Her dream is to buy herself some property and a truck. In her free time she likes to play basketball and indoor soccer. She is very thankful for her former loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, insecticides, urea, liquid herbicides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Alkadira Valeska

texts.es: La joven Alkadira de 24 años de edad, es casada actualmente no trabaja pero con el apoyo económico de su esposo se está preparando estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en administración de empresas ya que para ella obtener su titulo es muy importante porque le facilita nuevas oportunidades de empleo donde pueda desarrollar sus conocimientos obtenidos durante toda la etapa de la universidad, por esta razón ella solicita apoyo de crédito a Afodenic y Kiva para poder pagar su curso de titulación.
texts.en:
Alkadira is a 24-year-old young woman.  She's married and doesn't work right now, but with her husband's support she's getting ready to study for an advanced degree in business administration.  She wants to get her degree because it will open up new work opportunities for developing the knowledge she obtained in the university.

This is why she's requesting loan support from AFODENIC and Kiva to be able to pay the fees to register her degree.

loans.use: to pay the fees to register her degree

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a very devoted woman who always looks for opportunities to get ahead in life. She has a great testimony for the great achievement she has had since she started receiving loans from Yehu and Kiva. The previous loan had a very substantive impact on both her business and her living standards.

Agnes is asking for a new loan to expand her business. She would like to buy bales of clothing, cosmetics, and other beauty products so as to meet her customer orders. She is sure to have more income out of this investment.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, cosmetics, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Mila Rose

texts.en:
Mila Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat and spices vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of products to sell for her meat and spices vending business. Mila Rose has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

Mila Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat and other spices to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms Shabana is 29 years old, and she lives in a one-bedroom house with her husband and daughter. When her husband failed to find employment, Shabana decided to use the skill her mother had taught her at a very young age and earn some money for her family. She started stitching for females in the neighborhood. She became famous by doing her fine stitching. 

In order to meet her orders on time, Shabana has requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR), which enable her to purchase material such as spools of thread and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors. This will enable her to meet the growing demands of her customers, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.  Shabana is passionate about her work, and informed us that she is planning on preparing fancy dresses so she can sell them to retailers in the city Faisalabad.

loans.use: to purchase material, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
El  Sr.  Purificacion  tiene 58 años de edad, tiene un local alquilado donde realiza trabajo de gomería y venta de cubiertas   desde  el año 1970.
Debido a que lleva más de 40 años trabajando en esto, ya se hizo de mucha clientela, y es muy conocido por el buen servicio que da a sus clientes. Cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas con vehículos que mandan a realizar trabajos de gomería; y con este trabajo logro mejorar  su  nivel de vida y la de su familia.
El necesita de este crédito para la compra de herramientas que utiliza en la gomería, ya que las que tienen deben ser cambiadas para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Purificacion is 58 years old. He has a rented shop where he has been providing tire repair services and selling hubcaps since 1970.

Since he has been in business for more than 40 years, Purificacion has accumulated many customers. He is well-known for the good service he provides to his customers. There are many people who bring their vehicles to him whenever they are in need of tire repairs. Through the work he has achieved, Purificacion has been able to improve his standard of living and that of his family.

He needs a loan so that he can buy tools for performing tire repairs. His equipment needs to be replaced so that he can continue providing good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools for performing tire repairs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as an honest and intelligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. Her business is located within a semi-urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to re-sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run a boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Roena

texts.en: Roena is 68 years old. She is from a small village in the Mtskheta district. She lives with her husband. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Roena sells cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Roena also owns a plot of land, where she grows different kinds of vegetables. She is very hardworking and does her best to ensure a good harvest. Roena requested a loan to purchase building materials. After buying building materials she will be able to finish renovating her house. The renovation will improve their living conditions. Roena awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating her house

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four active women entrepreneurs in Bolangir town in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Mangala to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. Nirasa is one of these women. The lady standing second from left, wearing a red shawl in the photograph, is Nirasa. Nirasa, 32 years old, is a very energetic lady who lives with her husband, one son who is 13 years old and one daughter who is 7 years old. The children are continuing their studies in the local school. 

Nirasa has been running a general store in the heart of the town for the last two years with the help of her husband. She sells items like biscuits, dust tea, oil, shampoo, toffee, and grocery items. She has been able to increase the variety of items in her general store by taking her first loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Her daily net income from the existing business is around Rs 400/-. With this income, her household expenses are in a deplorable state.  Nirasa purchases items from the local wholesaler twice a week. With the present loan, Nirasa wants to increase her stock by purchasing items like lentils, oil, soap, washing powder, shampoo etc. for her general store. This will help her to increase her income and  reduce the purchasing costs as she replenishes her stock frequently.  Nirasa hopes to save enough money to provide a better education to her children. 

The other three members of the group are Nurjahan, Saraswati and Baidehi. They run a water servicing center, sell vegetables at wholesale and run a Tiffin (lunch) pushcart.

loans.use: To purchase lentils, oil, soap, washing powder, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Methuselah

texts.en:
Methuselah is 32 years old, married and the father of three children. For the last twelve years, he has earned a living by operating a butcher shop in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He is applying for his second loan of KES. 40,000 to buy additional stocks of meat products, and dairy products, like yogurt, to sell beside the shop. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees, as well as to expand the business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can continue looking after his family by providing them with a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of meat products, and dairy products, like yogurt, to resell.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 43 years old, and from the small village of Supsa district, West Georgia. She lives with her husband and two daughters (3 and 6 years old). 

The family runs an agricultural business.  They have a cow and a calf, whose milk is used in dairy products. Lali also owns a plot of land, where she grows maize and nuts. Lali sells the harvested maize and nuts with the dairy products locally, and at a good price. She is very hard-working woman, and has rich experience in her business. 

Lali requested a loan for purchasing potato seeds and building materials for a greenhouse. She will sow different kinds of vegetables in the greenhouse, and increase the income of her family. With increased income, the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and building materials for a greenhouse.

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en: Fawzia is a 40-year-old housewife taking care of her three kids. Fawzia and her husband have a number of goats and use the goat's milk to make yogurt and cheese for sale. Now Fawzia is applying for this loan to increase the number of goats she has in order to increase the amount of milk she gets, and therefore increase her productivity.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats

loans.name: Fakry Group

texts.en: This group is called Fakry and consists of five ladies who live in Hodeidh, Yemen. Slama is 49 years old, married, and has eight children. She started her business with a small amount of capital and sells incense, perfumes, and Henna. She has been operating her business for 5 years. She applied for a loan of 15,000 YER from AMB to buy incense, perfumes, and Henna for her business. She hopes to open a store for selling perfumes and Henna.

loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, and Henna for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 32 years old.  She has been selling clothes commonly known as Bitenge for four years. With the loan, she wants to add more bitenges for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her future.

loans.use: buy dresses to sell

loans.name: Najiya

texts.en:
Najiya is a 39-year-old, conservative married woman. She asked her husband, Khaled, to take her place in the photo.

Having seven children to take care of, as Najiya and Khaled have, is a big responsibility. For that, having a salary-paid job will not be enough to support the family. For that reason Najiya recently chose to start, with her husband, a scrap and recycled materials business. They collect the items from dumpsters and everywhere else, sort them in the back yard, and sell them to factories or other buyers. Now Najiya has applied for this loan, in order to get a new cart that will make the collecting process easier and more efficient.

loans.use: to get a new cart that will make the process of collecting materials to be recycled, easier.

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en: Berthe is 37 years old. She sells fabrics and has been in the business for 17 years. She wants to use the loan to buy more fabrics to re-sell. With the profits from the business, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Qendrim

texts.en:
Qendrim is 27 years old and married. He lives in a southern part of Kosovo. For more than eleven years he has worked as a mobile food seller in his area. During the summer he sells ice cream and in the colder season he sells chestnuts. Qendrim is a very hardworking person. He starts work early in the morning and does not finish until late in the evening. 
Currently he buys chestnuts wholesale and then he bakes them in his shelf and sells them for 50 cents per packet, which makes a lot of profit for him. He is asking for a loan of EU 600 in order to buy chestnuts at wholesale. The loan will help him increase his profit. As he said his profit is more than 50%. It is a very profitable business because he doesn’t need much equipment or have many overhead charges. He hopes in the future to expand his business and to start selling in different cities of Kosovo. Knowing that this is Kiva loan, he is very appreciative of all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy chestnuts.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Buchanan. She is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 6 and 18 who are in school and live at home. Her husband works with RIA. Martha has been selling clothes for the past three years in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, 41, lives in Sinkor with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 11 and 22. Her children are attending school. Annie has a restaurant in her community where she sells different kinds of food. She works six day a week. She prepares cassava leaves, palava, fufu, and soup for her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: la Sra. Carolina  tiene 47 años tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 27 y 24 años,  ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos de primera necesidad, electrodomésticos, ropa, sabanas y edredones a pedido, ofreciendo sus productos a crédito, ella no tiene un puesto fijo ya que ofrece sus productos es distintos domicilios y mercados, la Sra. Carolina es cliente antigua ya que este préstamo es el  primero  que solicito en la institución,  la Sra. Carolina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos al por mayor,  la Sra. Carolina enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, la Sra. Carolina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Carolina is 47 years old and has two children aged 27 and 24. She works in retail, offering a variety of basic commodities, electrical appliances, clothing, sheets and quilts upon request, offering her goods on credit. She doesn't have a fixed place of business, since she sells her products in various shops and markets. 
Señora Carolina is a long-standing client, but this is the first time she is requesting a loan with the organization. She is going to use this loan to buy wholesale electrical appliances. Señora Carolina faces certain challenges in her business, such as the demand for new products, She is going to put the proceeds towards better customer attention and buying a variety of products. Señora Carolina is pleased and grateful for the support provided by the organization in the granting of loans.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Buenos días. Este es el Grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” conformado por 11 socios, la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona y pasan al ciclo 13. Alicia tiene 28 años casada y con 02 menores hijos. Cuenta con una bodega la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad lleva trabajando de esta manera hace más de 2 años. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Alicia ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. Su último crédito lo destinará como capital de trabajo, la cual comprara arroz, azúcar, leche y bebidas. El grupo  “Unidos Para Triunfar” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Alicia está ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Good day. This is the “Unidos Para Triunfar” (United For Triumph) Group, which has eleven members, most of whom are neighbours who spent 13 years together.

Alicia is 28, and is married with two young children. She owns a grocery store offering basic goods. She has been working in this for over two years. With the fruits of her efforts, Alicia has managed to make improvements to her house and support her children's education. Her biggest wish is to continue improving her business. 

She will use her latest loan as working capital, to buy rice, sugar, milk and drinks. The “Unidos Para Triunfar” Group are grateful for the credit given since it makes their progress possible. Alicia is second from the right at the back of the photograph.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and drinks.

loans.name: Fermin's Group

texts.es:
El señor Fermin esta casado, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica ala agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de papa, inicio este trabajo con sus padres y hasta ahora lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien se dedica a lo sofii del hogar.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamos que sera utilizado, para la compra de abono orgánico, ya que solo así tendrá mejores cosechas de papas, espera mejorar su trabajo y en el futuro tener mucho capital y propio.
texts.en:
Fermin is married. He is 39 years of age. He completed 2 years of primary education. He has 6 children, 2 of whom are studying. He works in agriculture, specifically growing potatoes. He started doing this work with his parents, and now has 20 years’ experience. He has the support of his wife who takes care of the household chores.

He has organised a group in order to request a loan that will be used to buy organic fertiliser, as this gives the best potato crop. He hopes to improve his farming work and in the future to have a lot of capital and of his own.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to grow crops

loans.name: Mayda Acela

texts.es: Mayda de 53 años tiene un negocio que consiste en la elaboración de trabajos en Foamy y lencería, como canastillas, toldos, toallas, cortinas etc. Ella también elabora calzado en épocas especiales como carnaval, navidad, temporada escolar etc. Su negocio lo inició, teniendo como fundamente su aptitud en las manualidades y su experiencia desde el año 1977, cuando participaba con una amiga suya en ferias,  haciendo arreglos florales en telas,  al cual adicionaron artículos para bebes y todo lo que hoy tiene que ve con la muñequería y el calzado. En la actualidad se prepara para acceder a un credikiva,  porque necesita estar invirtiendo continuamente debido a que tiene pedidos en muñecos de felpa, collares, sandalias, bolsos, tapetes y muchos otros artículos en lencería. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará materias primas e insumos, como telas, foamy, hilo y accesorios, para adornar todo lo que haga. Sus principales clientes son los propietarios de pequeños almacenes en el centro de la ciudad, a quienes les vende de contado y a crédito y las amas de casa, que quieren tener sus viviendas bien adornadas con motivos nostálgicos navideños y/o necesitan dar sus aguinaldos a sus seres queridos y amigos. Su meta es lograr apoyar a su hija para que termine sus estudios profesionales; Mayda también desea superarse continuamente, para salir adelante con su negocio y beneficiar a su familia, a la que ama profundamente.
texts.en:
Mayda, 53, has a business that consists of the creation of craft foam and linen goods, such as baskets, canopies, towels, curtains, etc. She also makes footwear on special occasions such as Carnaval, Christmas, the school season, etc. 

She began the business herself, having as a foundation her ability to make crafts and her experience beginning in the year 1977, when she participated in fairs with a friend of hers, making floral arrangements on fabrics, to which they added baby goods and all the things that today have to do with dolls and footwear.

Today, she is preparing to access a Kiva loan because she needs to be investing continuously due to the fact that she has orders for plush dolls, necklaces, sandals, bags, mats, and many other linen items.

Her loan is the first financing Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will have done for her. With it she will buy materials and supplies such as fabric, craft foam, thread and accessories, with which to decorate everything she does. 

Her principal clients are small store owners in the center of the city, to whom she sells in cash and on credit, and housewives, who want to have their homes well-decorated for reasons of Christmas nostalgia and/or they need to give Christmas boxes to their friends and loved ones. 

Her goal is to support her daughter in finishing her professional studies. Mayda also hopes to continue to surpass herself, to move forward with her business and benefit her family, who she deeply loves.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies such as fabric, craft foam, thread and accessories, to decorate with

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 63 years married and blessed with four children aged 15, 12, 7 and 3.  He owns a tailoring shop and has been in operation for the past 10 years earning an income of KES 20,000 monthly.  

He is now servicing his 10th loan of KES. 45,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully and intends to use this amount to purchase textiles for his business.  

The profits earned will be used to invest back into the business. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase textiles for his tailoring business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He has been farming for the last eight years, and he grows onions and french beans. He is very hardworking and strives to always meet his targets and produce more onions and french beans. Faulu Kenya has helped him increase his production and also to learn to save his money.

He wishes to have five acres of land to cultivate on and also increase his farm produce. He needs a loan of 47,951 KES to buy manure, seeds, and chemicals for his onions and french beans.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and chemicals for his onions and french beans

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Buchanan along with her fourteen-year-old child that is in school.  Rebecca is 39 years old, married, and has been involved in a local soap making business for the past 13 years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother.  She is asking for a loan to buy more caustic and oil for her business.  Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more caustic and oil for her soap making business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children. He has been in the fruit and vegetable business for the last 14 years and earns a monthly income of KES 23,800.

He is now servicing his second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to purchase two lorries of fruits in season to sell at wholesale. 

The anticipated profits will enable him to support his family and expand his business. He hopes that one day his business will grow and he will purchase a lorry for transport.

loans.use: To buy two lorries of fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 31. She sells “Bitenge," a type of local clothing. She wants the loan to add more Bitenge in her store. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more Bitenge for sale.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 34 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She operates a small cafe in Malindi where she earns a monthly income of about KES 7,500. 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and, at the moment, she needs funds to purchase additional food stock such as wheat flour and cooking oil, and items such as serving spoons and more tea cups. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000. 

The anticipated income from the items purchased by the loan will help improve the financial status and living standards of her family and she will be able to help pay school fees for her children. Beth intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will own a well established hotel in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional food stock such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and items such as serving spoons and more tea cups.

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim is 31 years old. He is married and has two children ages four and eight years old. They all live in a village. His wife is housewife, staying home to take care of the children and the house. Two years ago Bekin began work in the agriculture business. 
Bekim needs EU 2000 to buy 10 sheep and to renovate his stable roof. The loan will help him cut some expenses like milk and milk products for his family. His goal is to expand his farm and to be able to sell the sheep as well to generate even more income. He hopes to offer a better life to his family. He promises to pay on time and is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and renovate his stable roof.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She has been in the wholesale business for two years now and it generates a monthly income of KES 34,800.

She has a good credit history and is now her third loan for KES 100,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to purchase assorted accessories to sell at wholesale prices to her customers. 


The anticipated profits will be used to expand her business and she hopes that one day her business will grow to have over one million items in stock.

loans.use: to buy assorted accessories at wholesale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have seven children. She sells stoves and has spent five years selling stoves and saucepans. She has requested the loan to buy more stoves to re-sell. The profits from the business will be put into savings. Claudine is very thankful for her previous loan, which helped her greatly.

loans.use: to buy saucepans and cups to sell.

loans.name: Ritag Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ritag. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.
Abeer is a 29-year-old married woman. She works hard so she can offer a good life to her family.
She is applying for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her home.
She hopes to open a home appliance store as a business to earn more profit and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her home.

loans.name: Phoibe

texts.en:
Phoibe is 25 and single. She sells clothes, and has spent two years in the business. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for a better future.

She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her in the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Olsa

texts.en:
Olsa is 34 years old, a married Roma from south central Albania. She has two children; unlike others in their community, she chose to send them to school. She is proud of this, and considers it to be her major accomplishment. To support her family and most specifically to educate her children, she has been working next to her husband for all these past years.

Olsa has been a seamstress for the past 3 years, and the people she serves are her neighbors, and others from her community. In addition to this, she also sells used clothes and other items at the Roma market. 

Her oldest child, her son, has been accepted to a college and starts in January. She needs this loan to pay for his tuition fees. 

She will very much appreciate anyone’s financial help.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college tuition fees.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 30 years old and single.  He sells spare parts, and has been running the business for the past 7 years. 

With the loan, he will buy more spare parts for sale. He plans to use the profits to accumulate savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy more parts for the bicycles and motorbikes spare parts business he runs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, especialmente ropa y calzado artículos que ofrece a crédito a una clientela que ha construido entre empleadas del servicio doméstico en Boca Grande un sector exclusivo de la  ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde vive con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo. Ella realiza la misma actividad que su madre quien está vinculada también ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y quien le enseñó todas las estrategias comerciales que ahora utiliza para generar ingresos con su negocio;  anteriormente Nora  había recibido dos financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales invirtió en ropa y calzado, que vendió prontamente;  así su rentabilidad la aplicó a la compra de un colchón que necesitaba y medicinas para reforzar el crecimiento de su hijo y esto la hace muy feliz porque satisface sus necesidades familiares, junto a su cónyuge quien es vigilante de un edificio y también vende en el área donde se encuentra ubicado. Desde que recibió su crédito, su negocio creció amplió el número de sus clientes y aumentó su calidad de vida. Ella da sus agradecimientos a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por haberle facilitado el dinero a un mejor costo y por eso está aplicando a un primer credikiva, con el cual comprará  ropa y calzado, provisionándole a su clientela la ropa y el calzado a ccrédito, que su familia utilizaría en el mes de Diciembre época de gran derroche comercial y en la que la gente quiere vestirse elegante,  para recibir las navidades y el año nuevo unidos en su hogar.
texts.en: Nora earns a living selling various merchandise, especially clothes and shoes, articles which she offers on credit to a clientele that she has built among domestic service employees in Boca Grande, an exclusive sector of the city of Cartagena de Indias where she lives with her husband and her small son.  She performs the same activity as her mother who is also connected with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and who taught her the commercial strategies that she now uses to generate income with her business.  Previously, Nora had received two loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she invested in clothes and shoes that she quickly sold and she applied her profits to the purchase of a mattress that she needed and medicines to strengthen her child’s growth. That made her very happy because she was able to satisfy her family’s needs, along with her husband, who is a security guard at a building and who also sells in the area where they live.  Since she received her loan, her business grew; she increased the number of customers and her quality of life improved.  She gives her thanks to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for having facilitated the money at a better cost and because of that she is applying for her first Kiva loan, with which she will buy clothes and shoes.  She will use what she purchases to supply her customers with clothes and shoes during the month of December, a period of great commercial spending in which people want to dress elegantly, so that her family can celebrate Christmas and New Year’s together in their home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La señora Doris tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos vive con ellos en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Hace 10 años que ella estableció una pulpería la que ha venido surtiendo poco a poco. Vende productos de limpieza y aseo personal, azúcar, arroz, harina, manteca, pastillas, pan, pastas, salsinas, verduras y otros abarrotes. Doris ha solicitado a ODEF  un tercer préstamo que  es por 12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más productos como granos básicos, refrescos, carnes, verduras y otros de consumo diario para mantener surtido su pulpería. Con esta inversión va seguir incrementando las ventas y sus ingresos ya que su objetivo es tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She and her family live in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.

Ten years ago, Doris established a convenience store and was able to stock it a little bit at a time. She sells merchandise such as cleaning products, toiletries, sugar, rice, flour, lard, medicines, bread, pastas, sauces, vegetables, and other grocery items.

Doris is requesting her third from ODEF in the amount of 12,000 HNL. She will use the money to buy more products such as basic grains, soft drinks, meats, vegetables, and other daily consumables to maintain the inventory of her store. With this investment, she will continue to increase her sales and her earnings. Her goal is for her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, meats, vegetables, and other daily consumables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her dental practice.

loans.name: Hekuran

texts.en:
Hekuran is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo. Before he opened his own café, Hekuran used to work as a DJ in another café. Three months ago he opened a café of his own. In his café, the consumers are mostly young people. His café has become famous very fast, and he has a lot of customers.
 
Hekuran needs to renovate -- that is, to paint, to buy pictures and other wall decor, and to buy tables and chairs to use in his café. The loan will help the atmosphere in the café and create a more comfortable and relaxing environment for his customers to enjoy. 

Hekuran’s goal is to save money and to offer a better life for his family. He hopes to expand his cafe in the future. He is very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate his café, including painting it, buying pictures and other wall decor, and buying tables and chairs.

loans.name: Patience  S.

texts.en:
Patience, 29, is a high school student. She lives in Sinkor, with her husband and a child, who is 10 years old.  The child is in school. 

Patience has a table where she sells flour, butter, milk, sugar and eggs. She has done this for the past fifteen years. She learned to sell from her mother. She makes profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business, and she pays the educational expenses of her child. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, milk, sugar and butter, to resell in her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, milk, flour and butter, to resell in her food stall.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 29 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,500. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 to buy additional stock of dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts, etc to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a businesswoman who owns a grocery store where she sells potatoes, peas, carrots and cabbage. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She also earns an income through farming and has been selling groceries for the last eight years. She learned how to save her money thanks to the financial help Faulu Kenya offered her. 

She hopes to own a retail shop in the future. She needs a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy potatoes, cabbage, peas and carrots.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbage, carrots and peas

loans.name: Ilaz

texts.en:
Ilaz is fifty six years old, married with 4 children. Together with one of his sons, he generates income by transporting goods. 

They all live in very poor, unsanitary, and unhealthy conditions. Their house needs to be renovated with basic things like doors and windows, and the roof is very old. Ilaz needs a loan to replace the roof, and to buy doors and windows.  He hopes that the loan will improve the living conditions for his family. 

Ilaz hopes to purchase the doors and windows as soon as possible, to avoid the extreme cold weather during the winter. 

In the future, he hopes that his children will be able to receive an education and have a better life. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To replace the roof, and to buy doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has 4 children. She sells crates of eggs, cassava, plantains, bananas, and groundnut in Elmina.  Efua uses her income to pay her children’s school fees.  Efua will use the loan to purchase crates of eggs, bananas, and a variety of fruit for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for further growth

loans.use: to purchase crates of eggs, bananas, and a variety of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba has been operating a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) for two years. The food she serves are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls.  She is married and has 4 children.   Araba uses her income to help her husband pay for their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase  maize, cassava, bush meat, and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profits, Araba plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, bush meat, and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Sulley

texts.en:
Sulley is a food vendor. She sells Ga-kenkey (fermented corn dough cooked in corn or banana leaves) and serves it with okra soup and fish at Ampeyin, near Elmina. 

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a security officer. She supports her partner to educate, feed and clothe her children. 

Her loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to cook her Ga-kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to make a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to cook her Ga-kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a food vender; she  sells  maize porridge, which she serves with bread and milk.  She is married and has 2 children.  

Esi has been in this business for 3 years.  Together with her husband, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children's school fees.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge, and the bread, to sell. With the new profit, Esi will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her bread and porridge to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 6 to 14 years. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more firewood to sell. Her business goal is to open a retail store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 25, is married and has two young children.  She lives with her family in the municipality of Mombasa. Four years ago, Juliana decided to start selling omena (dry fish). She was motivated to start this business in order to contribute towards her home and attain economic independence. She sells at the market.

Juliana has requested a 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish to sell.  She mentions that she’s very grateful for the financial support provided, because she will be able to improve her income, gradually grow in the business, and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is a fishmonger. Ama buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale. Ama has been selling smoked fish for 10  years. She is married and has 5 dependents. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. Ama will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. Ama will expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: purchase fresh  fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a baker from Elmina. She bakes pies for distribution to her customers. She is currently married and lives with her five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She responsibly supports her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, salt and other items to bake items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and other items

loans.name: Safi

texts.en: Safi is 30 years old. She sells “Bitenge” (local dresses), blouses and skirts. She wants the loan to add more bitenge and blouses to her store. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bitenge and blouses to sell

loans.name: Wavinya

texts.en:
Wavinya is 48 years old. She is a married mother and has one school-age child. Her business is selling clothing, footwear and underwear for men, women and children. She has been in this business since 2008. 

Wavinya needs this loan to buy clothing and shoes for the winter season. She has made good sales and, as a result, her number of customers and the number of orders she receives have increased. This is very positive for her, as it means her income will increase and she will be able to provide her child with a decent life. She would like her child to finish their education and to be able to finish building her modest home.

loans.use: to buy winter season clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina, 32, is married and comes from vulnerable population community. She has two children aged two and four years old. Her husband works in a municipal job that earns him a very low salary. 

Jasmina grows different types of vegetables in her own greenhouse. She sells them from her greenhouse to others in her community in order to earn more money for her family. In the beginning her greenhouse was a small one, but she has since managed to increase its size. 

Jasmina is applying for a 2000 EUR loan from KosInvest to pay for another greenhouse and to buy more vegetable seeds. By expanding her vegetable business she can earn more in profits. She hopes to see it grow yet more. She is very happy to have the opportunity to receive this loan!

loans.use: To pay for another greenhouse and to buy more vegetable seeds

loans.name: Lumturije

texts.en:
Lumturije is a married woman from vulnerable population community. She has five children ages between 5 and 13 years old. Her husband works as musician who performs for weddings. They live in a small house with only two rooms. 

She is a very hardworking women and is always smiling, despite the fact that she lives in very bad conditions. Lumturije is in need of a loan to renovate two rooms because they are very old. This loan will improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes in the future to find a job in order to get more income for her children. 

She is very grateful for the opportunity and thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate two rooms

loans.name: Shohruhjon

texts.ru: Шохрухчону 21 год. Он очень успешный студент. Шохрухчон учится на 3 курсе Технологического Университета Таджикистана по специальности Международная экономика. Шохрухчон упорно занимается над своими знаниями. Он очень способный молодой человек и планирует стать будущим хорошим специалистом. Его родители не в состоянии оплатить в этом году за его учебу. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shohruhjon is 21 years old. He is a very successful student. Shohruhjon is studying his third year at Technological University of Tajikistan with a major in International Economics. He's very dedicated to his studies. 

He is a very capable young man and plans to become a good specialist in the future.  His parents are not able to pay for his tuition this year. He is asking for a loan to pay for the school contract. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 36 years old and married, the father of three children. 

He has been working in shoe selling since eight years ago. He has special customer care, and he is smart and talented in dealing with all types of customers.

Samer is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower since seven cycles, with a good standing paying back history. He is very proud to deal with Al Majmoua, since it's the only NGO in Lebanon that supports Palestinians.  He attests that his previous loans helped a lot in increasing his income and developing his business.
Samer is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase his products with a new autumn-winter shoe collection.  Samer is looking to be able to travel  to China, importing products to start a wholesale trade in the future.

He hopes to provide for his family, especially his three children, giving them the best childhood and education ever.

loans.use: to increase his products with a new autumn-winter shoe collection.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Né  vers 1980 à Ségou, marié et père de 2 enfants, Idrissa vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec ses parents dans la ville de Koutiala. Comptable de formation il est le gérant du dépôt pharmaceutique de son père depuis plusieurs ans.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il décide de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 4eme prêt,  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat de cartons produits pharmaceutiques auprès des pharmacies grossistes de la ville. Il effectue sa vente en détail au comptant, à une clientèle mixte.
Idrissa envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Idrissa was born in 1980 in Ségou. He is a married father of two, and lives in a traditional large family with his parents in the town of Koutiala. He is a trained accountant, and has worked for several years managing his father's pharmaceutical store. In order to ensure that his ever-increasing customer base remains satisfied, he has decided to seek assistance from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and is on his fourth loan. This loan will be used to buy boxes of pharmaceutical products from pharmaceutical wholesalers located in his town. 

Idrissa sells on a cash and credit basis, and has a varied clientele. He plans to make a monthly income of 150,000 francs CFA, which he will use to repay his loan and cover his family's expenses. The rest of the money will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Née en 1983 à Koutiala, Sanata a 3 enfants et elle est la 3e femme de son mari.
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers de commerce : parures, habits, tissus, pagnes wax, draps de lit….
Nantie de 10 ans d’expériences, elle est très appréciée et sollicitée par sa clientèle.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les 2 prêts précédents, elle est à son 3eme , qui sera utiliser pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagnes wax et autres articles à Lomé (Togo). Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit, en ambulant et au marché, à une clientèle mixte.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sanata was born in 1983 in Koutiala, and has three children. She is her husband's third wife. She did not have the opportunity to continue her studies, but quickly became interested in profit-making activities, particularly the purchase and sale of miscellaneous items: linen, clothing, fabrics, pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] made using a traditional wax process, bed linen, etc. 
 
With her 10 years of experience, Sanata is recognized and in great demand among her customers. Having correctly repaid her two previous loans, she has requested a third, which will be used to buy 20 lengths of wax pagnes and other items in Lomé (Togo). Sanata sells on a cash and credit basis, on the street and in the market, and has a varied clientele. She plans to make a monthly income of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to cover the family's expenses. The rest of the money will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] made using a traditional wax process

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une grande famille polygame  avec son mari et leurs enfants dans  la ville de Koutiala.  
Aminata  n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis son enfance auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle entama l’activité de vente de fary (des galettes à base d’haricot) depuis  plus de 5 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car  elle est sollicitée par tout le quartier. 
Pour l’amélioration de son activité, en stockant du haricot et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plusieurs ans.   Aminata   a obtenu des prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) auprès de Soro Yiriwaso tous correctement  remboursés et elle est à son 5eme  prêt individuel.
 Elle s’approvisionne auprès des cultivateurs des villages environnant de Koutiala, effectue la préparation et la vente de fary à Domicile. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 50.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt  de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aminata is 39 years of age, married, and the mother of six children. She lives in a large polygamous family with her husband and their children, in the city of Koutiala. She did not have the opportunity to go to school, and this is why she started working in trade with her mother from a very young age. 

After having several profit-making businesses, Aminata now works selling fary (biscuits made from beans), and has done so for the past five years. She is well-known because she is sought-after throughout the entire neighborhood.  To improve her business by getting stocks of beans, as well as to ensure customer satisfaction, she wasted no time in joining the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution several years ago. 

Aminata has obtained group loans from Soro Yiriwaso  in the past, all of which were repaid on time, and she is on her fifth individual loan. She gets her supplies from farmers in the villages close to Koutiala, and prepares her fary biscuits and sells them from home. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which she plans to use to pay interest on her Soro Yiriwaso loans and contribute to paying her family's daily expenses. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama est âgé de 43 ans et vit dans une famille  polygame  avec son  épouse, il est père de 6 enfants et habite dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Du à des problèmes de famille, il a prématurément abandonné l’école et s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est basé sur  la vente de poissons fumés il y a plus de 10 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car Les poissons fumés sont les plus prisés à Koutiala.  Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il a décidé de rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 3eme prêt individuel et les précédents ont été bien remboursés. Il s’approvisionne à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo  et  Somonô et effectue sa vente au  marché poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant et à crédit. Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 80 000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Adama is 43 years of age, and lives in a polygamous family with his wife. He is a father of six children, and lives in the town of Koutiala. Due to family problems, he left school early, and became interested in profit-making activities from a very young age. After several unsuccessful businesses, he now works selling smoked fish, and has done so for more than 10 years. He is well-known because the smoked fish he sells are the most sought-after in Koutiala. 

In order to be able to increase his working capital and strengthen his sales capacity, Adama decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He is now on his third individual loan, and his former loans were all successfully repaid. He gets his supplies in Korientzé, in the region of Mopti, from Bozo and Somonô fishermen. His sales are made in Koutiala fish market to male and female customers, on a cash and credit basis. 

With this financing, Adama hopes to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which he will use to pay the interest on his Soro Yiriwaso loan and provide for his family. The rest of the money will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a fishmonger at Ampanyi, near Elmina. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries and smokes them for sale. She has been in this business for some years. Yaa is married to a fisherman and has three children. Yaa helps her husband to feed and clothe their children. Yaa will use her loan to purchase more fish, which she will fry and smoke for sale. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry and smoke for sale.

loans.name: Manaan

texts.en: Manaan sells doughnuts, spring rolls and local drinks at Elmina. The picture shows Manaan in the process of making spring rolls. She has four children. Her husband repairs electronic equipment. She responsibly supports her husband in advancing the well-being of their household. Her loan will be used to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar to make doughnuts and spring rolls for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business in order to open a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar to make doughnuts and spring rolls for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi lives together with the husband, a driver, and her two children at Ampanyin near Elmina. Esi is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them to sell, which she has done for five years . She is married with two children. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. Esi will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. Esi plans to reinvest for further growth

loans.use: to purchase fresh  fish to smoke

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married to a fisherman and has two children. Ama sells soap and raw rice at Ampenyin, near Elmina. She has done this work for two years. She uses her income to assist her husband in feeding their children and paying the children's school fees. Ama will use her loan to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to resell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to resell.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta linda ciudad es originaria la señora Ana María García, una mujer muy esforzada con buenos valores morales. Es  madre soltera con una edad de 57 años y tiene una numerosa familia compuesta de siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente.

Doña Ana es obrera del tabaco de una fabrica procesadora de este rubro desde hace más de nueve años, con el salario lo destina para gasto de la consta básica del hogar, Ana cuenta con la ayuda económica de todos sus hijos ya que todos trabajan como obrero.

El crédito que solicita a ceprodel lo destinara para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena y cemento ya que va mejora el piso de su casa embaldosándolo; se siente con mucho animo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esteli el Diamante de las Segovia is the beautiful city where Ana Maria Garcia is from, a hardworking woman with good moral values.  She is a single mom, 57 years old and has a numerous family formed by seven children all adults and independent.

Ana is a tobacco journey-woman at a processing plant, has done this for more than nine years, with her salary she pays for the basic products needed in her house, Ana gets financial help from all her children who work as journeymen.

The loan requested to ceprodel is to buy construction materials such as sand and cement, to make renovations to the floor in her house; she is very hopeful about making betterments to her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and cement.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells gari, a food made out of cassava, at Ampayin near Elmina. She has done this for two years.

Adjoa is married and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. 

Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is married to a carpenter and has four children. She is a baker who bakes pastries to sell in Ampayin, near Elmina. She has done this for some time. Paulina uses her income to support her husband in paying their living expenses. She will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake her pastries. With her new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en: Meena cooks maize porridge for sale, along with bread and milk. She is married with four children. Meena has been in this business for four years. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children and paying their school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her bread and porridge to sell. With the new profit, Meena  will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare bread and porridge to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a baker at Elmina. She bakes bread and pies for distribution to her customers. She is married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She supports her husband in educating, feeding and clothing their children. She will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for baking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for baking.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman. She sells clothes for both adults and kids. She has been in the business for ten years. The profits from the business will be used to create more savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
People are always looking to better themselves. It doesn't matter when they do it because the goal is to get ahead and build a more prosperous future. That is the case with this young woman. She has great skills, and is honest, hardworking and enterprising. She lives with her family, who is her main source of inspiration. She wants to offer them a better life, far away from the crime that surrounds them.

For some time, she has had a small workshop where she makes and sells a variety of clothing for men, women and children such as shirts, blouses, dresses, and trousers. She does business every day and is well known in the area because of the way she serves them as well as product quality and good prices.

She wants to buy more fabric, lace, and thread, but does not have enough capital to do so. That is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, lace, and thread.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader who sells vegetable and foodstuffs. At the same time, cooks banku to sell at Elmina. She serves her banku with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.  Esi is single and has three children. She uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, vegetables and foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to start a restaurant

loans.use: to buy bags of maize, vegetables and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth, Madre soltero con dos hijos de 14, 5 meses de edad, ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ruth tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consiste en vender ropa de niño, ropa de adulto, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos, short, ropa interior, perfumees, cosméticos. El  objetivo del préstamo en invertir en capital de trabajo aumentar su mercadería y de dicha forma incrementar su ganancia. Y también aprovecha las ventas en la temporada navideña  y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El negocio lo distribuye de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Ruth es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias, sale a las calle a ofrecer mercadería donde clientes fijos y eventuales. Ruth agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother with two children, who are 14 years old and 5 months old. Se is originally from the Department of Chinandega, which is in the western region of the country. Ruth works buy selling general merchandise including clothing for children and adults, pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, perfume, and cosmetics. 

The reason for this loan is to invest in working capital to increase her merchandise and therefore increase her profits. She also takes advantage of sales during Christmas, and is able to meet her customers' demands. Ruth distributes her products by traveling. Her daily routine is to work ten hours a day. She goes out to the street to sell merchandise to regular and prospective customers. Ruth is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide help to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they may have a decent standard of living.

loans.use: to stock merchandise such as clothing for children and adults, pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, perfume, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alou Sanogo

texts.fr:
Agé de 29 ans, Alou a une épouse et est père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Alou est enseignant dans une école privée à Koutiala, en plus de cette profession il mène des activités de commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers de boutique et le stockage de céréales. 
Ces activités lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Alou a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs.  Il est à son  2e prêt  individuel qui sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises : cartons thé, de savon, des sacs de céréales et de sucres. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala KoKo à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, monsieur compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Alou is 29 years of age, is married, and is a father to three children. He lives with his family in the town of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso). He works as a teacher in a private school in Koutiala. In addition to this job, he also works in commerce, namely selling various store items and cereal stock. These businesses give him a fair amount of income, and he is often in demand and has many customers each day. 

To ensure customer satisfaction and to expand his business, Alou has sought assistance from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to meet his goals. He is on his second individual loan, which will be used to buy stocks of different types of merchandise, namely boxes of tea and soap, bags of cereal, and sugar. Alou gets his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala, and sells on a cash basis in a store in Koutiala KoKo to a mixed clientele. 

With this expansion of his business, Alou hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to pay the interest on his Soro Yiriwaso loan and provide for his family. The rest of the money will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of merchandise

loans.name: Najeeb

texts.en: Najeeb is a 28-year-old, married man who has children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a pharmacy, and he expends great energy to get profit so he can offer a good life for his family. He started his business with capital from his dad so that he could open his pharmacy. He applied for a youth loan of 200000 YER from AMB, which he will use to buy medicines for his business. He hopes to expand his pharmacy to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Yoramu

texts.en: Yoramu is a father of seven children. They all go to school.  He is 49 years old. He sells foodstuffs such as beans and maize flour. With the loan, he wants to buy more beans and maize flour to sell. He wants to use the profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 37 years old. She describes herself as happy, hard-working, and responsible with her children. She lives with her husband and their five children in the city of Mombasa, which is located in the province of Coast.

Frida has a grocery store that has been active for the past year. This is her first loan with Yehu. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale groceries like rice, sugar, salt, flour, and other goods, which will allow her customers to have more variety. By taking this loan, Frida will be able to obtain good earnings and improve her quality of life.

Frida dreams that she will continue to be supported by loans so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries like rice, sugar, salt, flour, and other goods.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) in Abura.  Agnes is shown pounding fufu, which she has done for some years now.  The foods she serves are fufu, banku and rice balls. She is married with four children.  Agnes uses her income to support her husband and to pay their children's school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit,  Agnes plans to get a better place to enable her to serve her customers.

loans.use: purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets, stationary, phone cards, and materials to make linens.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín de  55 anos de edad, soltero con un hijo de 9 anos de edad, del departamento de Chinandega el Viejo lugar que se caracteriza por la pesca  tiene por actividad económica el servicio de pesca artesanal, en el cual tiene 15 anos de tener dicho negocio. El negocio consiste en pescar todo tipo de marisco en general como langosta, pescado de exportación y blanco el producto que pesca se lo vende a los acopiadores de la zona para la exportación. El negocio lo aprendió del papa el cual se dedica a dicha actividad. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar equipo de pesca y renovar los existentes. Benjamín agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 55, single has a 9 year old son, he is from the department of Chinandega el Viejo; place known for its traditional fishing technique activity, business that he's had for 15 years.
His business involves fishing all types of seafood such as lobster, fish of exporting quality and the product he gets he sells to the distributors in the area who export it.  He learned his business from his dad who also works in this activity.  He needs the loan to buy fishing equipment and renew what he already has.  Benjamin is thankful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified way to live.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a resident of the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, is a husband and father to two young children. With two shops in the community, he is a budding businessman. Peter's next aspiration is to own two Fresh Life toilets, which is why he has applied for a Kiva loan.

Peter would like to run two Fresh Life toilets because they are affordable, Fresh Life is a respectable brand in the community, and he would like to improve the sanitation of the environment in his neighborhood. Because he was never able to afford a formal education, Peter's dream is that profits from his Fresh Life business will enable him to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Noami

texts.en: Noami is 26 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a constructor; they have three children ages 3 to 10 years old. They live at home and attend school. For the past four years she has been operating a table where she sells palm oil. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna lives in Mombasa, Kenya with her husband. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. 

Edna has a food vending business, which she has been operating for four years. She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, baking powder, and food flavor. 

Edna's goal is to open a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, baking powder, and food flavor.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. She is grateful for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. Since the last loan, she has been able to increase sales and, hence, her overall income. She wants to make a new investment of capital in her business, so she is asking for a new loan. She will use it to buy bales of used clothing, to have a variety of items from which her customers can choose. She hopes to continue providing more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing, so she will have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 53 years old, married and has four children. All of her children have completed studying. She has been in business for three years and also practices farming to earn a living. She is a very responsible woman, and she has learned how to save since she joined Faulu Kenya.

Agnes wishes to expand her business and increase her profits. In order to fulfill her dreams, she requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy vegetables, bananas, potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 52-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 14 years to 24 years old. He describes himself to be jovial and a sociable man. He operates a carpentry workshop where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are residents from the environs, business people, etc. 

Tom describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of raw materials to make more furniture to sell. He will use the Kes 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his eight family members. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. In addition,Tom does farming; he sells farm produce to increase his business income.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Janciline

texts.en: Janciline is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman, and they have six children. They all go to school. She sells "bitenge" (lengths of traditional fabric) and ladies' clothes and has been in that business for 14 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more 'bitenge' for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El Sr. Isidoro vive en pareja con la señora Irma ambos tienen 59 años, y tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ellos, ya que los demás ya son todos mayores.
El Sr. Isidro tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa donde vende a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes bebidas en general, azúcar, arroz, panificados y otros insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar, además el señor Isidoro tiene una plantación de hortalizas en un terreno cercano a su casa, y de esa forma surte su negocio con verduras de una forma más económica para él.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de productos al por mayor, como ser carne, bebidas, enlatados y demás, ya que se acerca fin de año y desea aumentar su stock ya que en esa época suben el precios de los productos, y quiere poder mantener el buen precio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Isidro and his partner, Sra. Irma, are both 59 years of age. They have five children, but only one still lives with them. The others are already grown adults.

Sr. Isidro has a well-stocked food pantry in his home where he sells to his neighbors and occasional customers. He offers beverages, sugar, rice, baked goods, and other basic household necessities. In addition, Sr. Isidro plants vegetables on a plot of land near his house. By stocking his business with his own vegetables, he is able to generate a better profit.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk, such as meat, beverages, canned goods, and other items. With the end of the year approaching, he wants to increase his stock since prices go up during this time. He wants to continue offering affordable prices to his customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está felizmente casado, el es constructor de obras y dueño de una despensa en su casa, la cual atiende su esposa.
Comenta que ambos trabajan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante, hay que saben que la vida es dura, y la única forma de salir adelante es por medio del trabajo que se hace. Cuenta que al principio fue difícil, pero que hoy en día van creciendo y ya tienen muy buena clientela.
Con miras a seguir creciendo el Sr. Miguel solicita de este crédito, ya que quiere ampliar su despensa, vendiendo ropas, e invertirá su crédito en la compra de prendas de todo tipo y así tener mayores cosas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel is from the city of Encarnación, happily married, builder and owner of a pantry located in his house, which is manage by his wife.
