He says that both are working and striving to get ahead. They know that life is tough and the only way to get ahead is through the work they do. 

He point out that it was difficult at the beginning, but that today, the business has grown and already has very good clientele. With the intention to continue growing the pantry, Miguel requests this loan since he wants to expand by selling clothes. He plans to purchase clothing of all kinds and thus have larger inventory of products to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to expand his business

loans.name: Malinga

texts.en: Malinga is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children between the ages of 17 and 20. All of her children are in high school. She owns a hairdressing salon which she has been running for 12 years. She wants this loan to buy more products for her salon, including shampoo, as well as dreadlock, makeup and skincare products. Malinga will use the profits from the business to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.en: Dorothe is 44 years old. She is married with eight children. She has been selling fish and eggs to make a living, for the past 10 years. She wants to add more trays of eggs for sale, with this loan. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children, who are enrolled in various schools.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Al-Safa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Safa Group. It consists of 6 members who are all women. They are from Sana'a and they know each other very well. All their projects are home-based. However, they have many customers, mostly women. The group took a loan of 360,000 YER. 

Sabrin, the group leader, is a 28-year-old woman, who is a housewife. She acquired her profession of dressmaking long ago. Her main business is sewing, and due to her good reputation, she is able to attract more customers to her business. She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB, to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.name: Mirella

texts.es: Se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y Mirella se prepara para recibirla, surtiendo su negocio con articulos alusivos a estas temporadas; son tantas las personas que le compran que su negocio que no alcanza a responder a esta demanda y ella necesita invertir permanetemente para ser oportuna. En sus 4 años de experiencia, Mirella conoce como se mueve su mercado en cada época, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en una de las temporadas mas comerciales donde sus ventas se incrementan para aprovecharla y ganar mas dinero. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva pues comprará juguetería, ropa infantil, adornos navideños, cosméticos y utiles escolares, porque despues de la navidad viene el regreso a la escuela y desde ahora debe surtir. Ella vende de contado en su punto comercial, el cual abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde diariamente y  hasta mas tarde, si su clientela así lo requiere. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del sector y de barrios aledaños, que conocen y recomiendan el negocio de Mirella y usualmente compan allí, porque saben que ofrece lo mejor  y a un buen precio. La meta de Mirella es lograr independizar su negocio de su espacio familiar para apoyar la educación de  su nieta a quien ama y desa ayudar.
texts.en:
Christmas and New Year's are coming, and Mirella is preparing herself for the season by stocking her business with the necessary items. So many people are buying from her store that she isn't able to respond to the high demand, and she needs to invest permanently in order to take advantage of this period. 

Thanks to her four years of experience in this business, Mirella knows how the market moves with each season. Therefore, she came to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo during one of the most commercial seasons, when her sales increase, in order to take advantage of this and earn more income. This is the reason why she is asking for a Kiva loan, which she will use to buy toys, children's clothing, Christmas decorations, cosmetics, and school supplies. She should start stocking up on school supplies now, since children will go back to school after the Christmas holidays.

She makes sales in cash in her business space, which she opens from 8am to 6pm daily, or later if it is necessary for her clients. Her main clients are her neighbors in her area and from nearby neighborhoods, who know and recommend Mirella's business and usually do their shopping there, because they know that she offers the best products at a good price. 

Mirella's goal is to make her business independent from her living space in order to support the education of her granddaughter, whom she loves and wishes to help.

loans.use: To buy toys, children's clothing, Christmas decorations, cosmetics, and school supplies.

loans.name: 22-Amanecer De Villa Tunari Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 22-AMANECER DE VILLA TUNARI está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. La Martha tiene 29 años y es soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  10, 8, 6  y 2 años, ella se dedica a  servicio costura de polleras para las cholitas, en su taller propio que se encuentran en zona Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela para la confección de polleras  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la gran demanda que tiene y la falta de capital para la compra de tela e hilos ya que tiene pedidos que entregar a distintos mercados, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de equipos y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de tela, La Sra. Martha es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en:
The Bank of Entrepreneurship 22-AMANECER DE VILLA TUNARI has eight members, of which six are women and two are men, who make their livings in different activities. 

The president of the bank es Martha, 29, who is single with four children ages 10, 8, 6 and 2. She makes a living sewing skirts for the "Cholitas" (members of a Bolivian indigenous movement) in her own workshop which is found in the Villa Tunari zone of the city of El Alto.

This is her first loan cycle within the Institution. Martha is going to use the loan to purchase fabric for the making of skirts. The reason she is requesting this loan is the large demand she has. She has orders to deliver to different markets, and lacks capital for the purchase of fabric and thread.

Martha faces challenges in her business such as the lack of equipment and sometimes a lack of material when they give her wholesale orders, depending on the work she has to do. She is going to use her profits to buy fabric.

Martha is a hard-working person whose wish is to have a big workshop and hire employees, and that way she can teach young people the trade of apparel making.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for the making of skirts

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama, 35, is a widowed mother of three children. Her children are between  the ages of 6 and 18. Two of her children live with their uncle; only one of them stays with her at home and is attending school. She received the initial capital from her father to start in this business.  She has been selling rice, palm oil, Vita, salt, onions, and cooking oil, at the community market for the past twenty years. 

Mama likes her business because with  her business she feels self-reliant. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods and pays back her loan. She has requested a loan to purchase more rice, Vita, onions, cooking oil for the business. Her plan for the future is to build house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, Vita, onions, and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio, de 58 años es un hombre trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: David y Gisela, a los que cuida en la casa de su hermana donde vive desde hace 40 años. Tiene 34 años de experiencia en la agricultura, todos los días sale a verificar sus tierras de cultivo y su esposa es su principal apoyo; los cultivos principales que produce son papa, trigo, cebada y quinua. También se dedica a la crianza de animales de ganado ovino.  Sus mayores ingresos se ven en la siembra de los granos por lo que cada vez más el intensifica su siembra en estos productos. Muchas veces para él y su familia este es un trabajo agotador pero que se compensa con las ganancias que le permiten cubrir sus gastos además de que siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una ventaja grande para su familia por lo que seguirá trabajando en esta actividad y mejorando la calidad de los suelos  cultivándola con abonos. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Eugenio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 58 years old, is a hardworking man. He lives with his two children, David and Gisela. He is raising his children in his sister's house, where he has lived for 40 years. 

He has 34 years of experience in agriculture. Every day, he goes out to check on his farmland. His wife is his main source of support. The main crops that he produces are potatoes, wheat, barley, and quinoa. He also raises sheep as livestock. His main income comes from sowing grains, so he continues to increase the sowing of these products. 

This is often an exhausting job for Eugenio and his family, but this is compensated by the earnings which allow them to cover their expenses. Additionally, there is always food for the family's own consumption, which is a great advantage for them. Therefore, Eugenio will keep working in this area and improving the quality of his fields by cultivating them with fertilizer. 

He has been working as part of a group with the communal bank "Productores Huancas" for several years, and this will be his twelfth loan with MFP. His perseverance is admirable, as he is one of the longest-standing members of the group. He continues to renew his efforts and his positive attitude.

Eugenio will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of organic fertilizer to distribute in the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edson y sus 2 hijos: Jhon y Jhomar, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 27 años. Tiene 15 años de experiencia compartida con su esposo en las tareas agrícolas, cultivan primordialmente la  papa, trigo y cebada, junto con su esposo  comparten estas arduas tareas tanto en la época de siembra y cosecha, de esta manera  cuando se recoge la cosecha de sus tierras de cultivo venden directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad y es así como tienen mayores ganancias sin intermediarios que por lo general  pagan un precio que no compensa el grande esfuerzo, Maruja  y su esposo desean seguir adelante en estas tareas por lo que desean aprovechar el campo que poseen para aumentar su ganado, pues posee 4 vacas de las que obtiene una buena producción de leche. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva. Maruja, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Maruja, 34 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Edson, and their two children, Jhon and Jhomar. She is raising her children in the house which she inherited 27 years ago.

She has 15 years of experience in agriculture, alongside her husband. The main crops which they grow are potatoes, wheat, and barley. She shares the arduous tasks with her husband during both the sowing and harvest periods. This ensures that, when they harvest their land, they can sell directly to merchants at the central market in their city. In this way, they can have a better income without intermediaries, who tend to pay prices that do not compensate for the farmers' efforts.

Maruja and her husband would like to continue with their work, so they wish to take advantage of the field they own in order to increase their livestock. They have four cows, from which they obtain a good milk supply.

Maruja has been working as part of a group with the "Productores Huancas" communal bank for several years, and this is her eighth loan with MFP. Her perseverance is admirable, as she is one of the oldest members of the group. She continues to renew her efforts and her positive attitude.

Maruja will invest this money in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy undergarments, outerwear, medication, multi-use products, and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a clothes business, which she has been operating for ten years. She has one child.

Aziza learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and occasional low business seasons. 

Aziza is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothing, e.g., clothes, shoes, and handbags. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her meet her family's needs, especially school fees. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: To purchase stock of second-hand clothing, e.g., clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 23-year-old woman. She has been married for a short period of time. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover their needs.

Tamam is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. She will use the loan to buy new living room and dining room furniture, in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Tamam and her husband comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

Tamam and her husband are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the home she is making with her new husband.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Née à Bamako, Korotoumou est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et leurs enfants à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Korotoumou n’a pas eu la chance de faire des longues études, ce qui justifie son intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et vente de tissus, chaussures et autres depuis plusieurs ans. Korotoumou est très bien sollicitée par ses clients.  Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a plus de 2 ans. Elle est à son 3e prêt individuel et les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des stocks de marchandises constitués deux rouleaux de tissus, une douzaine de paires de chaussures et 10 draps de lit. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, participer aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Born in Bamako, Korotoumou is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children.  She lives with her husband and her children in Koutiala, in the Sikasso region.

Korotoumou did not have the opportunity to attend school for many years, which explains her current interest in income-generating activities (such as buying and selling fabrics, shoes and others).  She has actually been involved in this activity for several years and her goods are in high demand from her customers.

In order to increase the size of her business and to meet the needs of her customers, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over two years ago.  This is her third individual loan; her past two loans were duly repaid.

With this new loan, she is planning to replenish her stock of goods and buy two rolls of fabrics, a dozen pairs of shoes and ten bedsheets.  She stocks up in Burkina Faso and sells in the city of Koutiala, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base which generally consists of women.

She is expecting monthly profits to reach 80,000 CFA francs.  She will use these profits to pay back her loan, contribute to the daily expenses of her family, and, with the rest of the money, continue her activity.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes and bedsheets.

loans.name: Meiva

texts.es:
Meiva  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres compartiendo todas las dependencias, ella cuenta con un ambiente el cual es su dormitorio, la casa es de sus padres es de ladrillo y el piso es de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Llojeta Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada, supervisora en ventas de una agencia de viajes donde percibe un salario mensual que cubre sus necesidades de transporte y alimentación. Ella  está estudiando en una de las universidades  de la ciudad de La Paz donde se encuentra en el tercer año de la carrera de turismo. El crédito quiere para la compra de una computadora portátil para realizar sus trabajos universitarios y mejorar sus estudios.
El sueño de Meiva es culminar sus estudios y así poder trabajar realizando viajes al exterior y conocer otras costumbres y así poder independizare de su familia..
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Meiva is single and has no children. She lives in her parents house, sharing all the rooms.  She has her own room, which is her bedroom. Her parents' home is made of brick with a cement floor, and is located in the Llojeta Bajo area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she is employed as a sales supervisor for travel agency, where she earns a monthly salary that covers her transportation and food needs. She is studying at one of the universities in the city of La Paz, where she is in the third year of the tourism degree program. 

She wants the loan in order to buy a laptop computer, so that she can do her university work and improve in her studies. Meiva's dream is to complete her education and to be able to work making trips to other countries; to get to know other ways of life, and be able to be independent from her family.

This is the first time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer that will help her with her tourism studies at the university.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu,  46, is a mother of four children and resides with her husband at Sinkor.  Her children are between the ages  of 4 and 15 and are currently in school. Bendu has been selling raw fish in the market for the past seven years. She makes profit when she sells because she always has her customers' favorite fish, cassava fish, and bonnie fish. With the profit generated from the business she buys more goods to increase her sales. She is requesting this loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business and hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose, tiene 21 años, es soltero, reside en el municipio de Morazan, Departamento de Yoro. Jose, tiene su propio taller de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas y mototaxis. Lo estableció hace dos años 5 meses en un local alquilado. Anteriormente trabajaba en un taller de este rubro y fue allí donde aprendió muy bien este oficio. El está solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar herramientas,repuestos, aceites, grasas y aditivos que necesita para brndar un mejor servicio al publico y tener a sus clientes satisfechos por el buen trabajo realizado. Su meta continua siendo la de mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su madre con la manuntencion de la familia.
texts.en: Jose, 21, is single and lives in the municipality of Morazan, in the department of Yoro.  Jose has his own maintenance and repair workshop for motorcycles and moto-taxis.  He set it up 2 years and 5 months ago in a rented space.  He previously worked as a mechanic in another workshop, and it was there that he learned this trade very well.  He is requesting a loan for 15,000 Honduran lempiras to buy tools, spare parts, motor oil, grease and additives that he needs to provide the best service to the public and keep his customers satisfied.  His goals are to continue to improve his house and to help his mother support the family.

loans.use: to buy tools, grease, and motor oil so that he can do maintenance work on motorcycles and moto-taxis

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es:
Clelia, de 55 años  y en la actualidad sigue cultivando sus terrenos, vive con sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. Desde su infancia aprendió los conocimientos básicos de las tareas del campo, hace 22 años se independiza  y realiza estas tareas para el bienestar de su familia, sus principales cultivos son papa, trigo, cebada y habas que lleva en cada cosecha a los principales mercados de su zona y en cada época de siembra y de cosecha ella  lleva a personas que la puedan ayudar en esta tarea y les paga  a cada uno según la jornal realizada, aunque esta tarea sea muy agotadora  es la única fuente de sustento que permite solventar todos los costos masque nada para la educación de sus hijas, es por ello que para el futuro Clelia desea incrementar la extensión de su terrenos para seguir sembrando más cantidad de sus productos agrícolas. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Clelia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuirlos en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Clelia is 55 years old and makes a living cultivating her land. She lives with her two daughters in her own house.

She learned the basic knowledge of farm work when she was a child. 22 years ago, she became independent and began to carry out these tasks for the well-being of her family. Her principal crops are potatoes, wheat, barley, and beans, which she brings to the local market after every harvest. During the sowing and harvest seasons, she brings in people who can help her with the work and pays each of them depending on the hours they have put in. 

This work is exhausting, but it is the only means of support for her expenses, especially for the education of her daughters. For this reason, Clelia wishes to expand her land to continue sowing higher quantities of her agricultural products. 

She has been working as part of a group with the "Productores Huancas" communal bank, and this is her sixth credit with MFP. Her perseverance is admirable, as she is one of the longest-standing members of the group. She continues to renew her efforts and her positive attitude.

Clelia will invest this money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to distribute during the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 62 años, es una mujer admirable. Enviudó hace 21 años, del que fue su esposo José, con quien tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos: Manuel en su casa propia. A pesar de criar sola a sus hijos, ella mantiene la misma fortaleza de siempre. Con la venta de verduras crió a sus hijos, de los que se siente orgullosa. Su trabajo es arduo, pues tiene que viajar a diferentes lugares y en días estratégicos, donde existe feria. Es así que de lunes a domingo trabaja sin descanso. Cuenta que ganan un promedio de 70 a 80 soles diarios. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir un lugar propio en el mercado de concepción de donde también vende. Por otro lado recibe el apoyo de su último hijo quien trabaja como albañil construyendo casa. Ahora desea abrir un negocio con el que pueda mantenerse sin preocupaciones por el resto de su vida.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las Wanquitas” y este es el crédito número 18 con MFP, donde está contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de verduras por canastas para su negocio en diferentes ciudades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Juana, 62 years old, is an admirable woman. She became a widow 21 years ago with the passing of her husband, José, with whom she had three children. She lives with one of her children, Manuel, in her own house.

Despite having raised her children alone, she remains as strong as ever. She is proud of the fact that she was able to raise her children by selling vegetables. Her work is arduous, as she needs to travel to different places on strategic days, when there are markets. She works from Monday to Sunday without a break.

She reports that she earns an average of 70 to 80 Peruvian soles per day. She was able to secure her own space in the market of Concepción, from which she makes sales. She also receives support from her youngest child, who works as a bricklayer constructing houses.

She would now like to open a business in order to maintain herself without any worries for the rest of her life. She is a member of the solidarity group "Las Wanquitas," and this is her eighteenth credit with MFP. She is happy with MFP because she will have financial support, which will allow her to feel secure moving forward with her work. She promises to comply with her payments. Furthermore, she enjoys being a part of her association, because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. 

Juana will invest this loan in the purchase of vegetables for her business, which she will buy by the basket in various cities in her area.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare motorcycle parts and additional salon equipment.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Nathaniel owns a shop selling diesel and petrol, a business that he has been running for six years. He also farms and has a transport business. Nathaniel learned of Milango from his friends and joined the group to access funds for his business. 

Nathaniel is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings to purchase petrol and diesel for sale. The main challenges in his business are scarcity and the high cost of fuel, as well as the fluctuation of prices. He looks forward to setting up his own business premises instead of renting and also to opening up another fuel outlet.

Nathaniel will use the additional income from the loan to pay for his child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase petrol and diesel for sale.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a resident of Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. Priscillar owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for four years. Priscillar began the business from a loan she obtained from a friend. She also sells milk.

Priscillar learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main business challenge is competition and the effect of low seasons.  

Priscillar is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standard. She aspires to own other centers, pay for her children’s education, and achieve security.

loans.use: To purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He sells fruit, a business he began using his own savings.  He has been running this business for the last fifteen years. Nicholas is a married father of three children, two of whom are in school.

He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase fruits and groceries to sell. He sells oranges, passionfruit, limes, mangoes, etc.

The main challenges he faces in business are bad debts and a lack of capital for expansion, a problem he hopes will be partly solved by this loan. He intends to sell fruit wholesale in the future. Nicholas will use the extra income from the business to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and groceries, e.g., oranges, passionfruit, limes, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem, who appears in the picture, is a 22-year-old single young man. He works across the border and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his daily expenses and also pay his university fees.

Ibrahem is still studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Ibrahem wants to complete his studies by paying his university fees, so he is requesting a 700 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover these. This will ensure a better future for Ibrahem and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child.  Irene owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for five years. She began the business from the savings she obtained while working as a baby sitter. She desires to set up a grocery stall.

Irene learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and fluctuating prices. 

Irene is applying for a loan of 62,700 KES to purchase food stuffs like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, and produce. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's standard of living. She aspires to own other centers and to ensure her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Hussnie

texts.en:
Hussnie, a 48-year-old married father of three sons and three daughters ranging in age from 15 to 22-years old, raises and sells poultry. With strong demand from his customers, his is a profitable enterprise.

Hussnie is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture. Receiving this loan will enable Hussnie and his family to better enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase living room furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Katwe Group

texts.en:
Madina is 30 years old and divorced. Her two children and a dependant attend a nearby school. 

She gets her income by selling food stuffs, which she uses to pay school fees and take care of other household necessities. Her previous loan was used to buy more food stuffs to sell, however she now wants to buy building materials to complete her house which is at roofing stage. It may not be enough, but she believes that with more loans and some savings she will be able to accumulate enough money to complete the construction. She is very hard working and shrewd despite her status as a single mother. Madina is the lady in the yellow T-shirt on the front row, the seventh member on the left is the group chairperson who has a running loan but is not taking with this sub group. She signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete her house

loans.name: Adeline Mireille

texts.fr:
Adeline Mireille est une dame âgée de 38 ans qui mène comme activité une alimentation dans un quartier de la ville depuis pratiquement 01 an. elle y vend de l'eau minérale, du savon, du pain, chocolat, beurre, biscuit... et elle prépare également du haricot qu'elle sert avec du pain à sa clientèle. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter acheter des sacs de riz, de spaguetis, des cartons de tomates, de biscuits et de savons. Ce qui lui permettra non seulement de renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi ça lui évitera de se rendre tous les jours au marché pour s'approvisionner. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
elle a pour ambitions d'ouvrir une bonne alimentation dans un conteneur de 20 pieds.
texts.en:
Adeline Mireille is 38 years old and has had a grocery shop in the city for almost a year. She sells mineral water, soap, bread, chocolate, butter, and cookies. She also makes beans that she serves to her customers with bread. 

With this loan, she would like to buy bags of rice, spaghetti, boxes of tomatoes, cookies, and soap. This loan will allow her to reinforce her inventory of goods and satisfy her clients. She will also no longer have to make daily trips to the market to buy supplies. This income will allow her to better meet the needs of her family. 

She would like to open a nice grocery shop in a 20 foot container.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahambu est la doyenne du collectif de crédit Tusaidiane, âgée d’environs  53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 12 enfants et plusieurs petits fils. Son mari est un serviteur de Dieu, Pasteur dans une église baptiste. La cliente est vendeuse de beignets, de gâteaux à son domicile. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit rotatif d’un mutuel locale de développement. Il ya plus de 5 ans, elle exerce cette petite activité économique. Elle vient de réaliser 23 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Dit-elle, que grâce à ce prêt, ses enfants étudient confortablement dans les universités de la place. Le faible capital constitue un défi majeur pour cet entrepreneur. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec la farine froment, levures, sucres, etc. Le reste d’argent servira pour payer les frais académiques pour ses enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en:
The client Kahambu is the head of the Tusaidiane loan group where the members are 53 years old on average. She is married and is the mother of 12 children and several grandchildren. Her husband is a pastor at a Baptist church. The client sells fritters and cakes out of her home. 

She started her company with revolving credit from a local development bank. She's been running her small business for close to 5 years. She just completed 23 cycles with Hekima's microloan program. It’s thanks to this loan, she says, that her children can comfortably study in the local universities. 

Her small amount of capital is a big challenge for her as an entrepreneur. This new loan will help her buy wheat flour, yeast, sugar, etc. The rest of the money will be used to pay for her children's schooling. She would like to grow her business. 

She thanks Hekima for their support and for the empowerment of female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, yeast, sugar, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Base

texts.en: Base is a 49-year-old woman who lives with her 60-year-old husband (in the photo) and 22-year-old son in Masis village of Ararat region. Agriculture provides the sole income for this family. They breed cattle and grow nut, plum and apricot trees. With the requested loan, Base is going to purchase barley seeds and fertilizer for autumn sowing, and grass for feeding the livestock during winter. Base hopes to gather a good harvest of barley next year and earn sufficient income from its sales to cover her family’s daily costs and secure its livelihood.

loans.use: to buy barley seeds, fertilizer and grass for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Najjera Twezimbe Women's Group

texts.en:
Florence is married and has six children who all go to school. She is a shrewd and hardworking woman who grows crops and also rears hens, cows and pigs.

She does most of the work with the help of her school-going children, who usually help her after school because her husband is sickly and is not able to work.

She will be able to complete payment of fees for the children with a loan of 300,000, she will also use the other half to buy plantains and greens. She also wishes to buy more cows soon if she accumulates money; these will provide a fallback in case of emergencies in the future.

Her major challenges are debtors and unpredictable weather changes. She hopes to use the next loan to buy a motorcycle for her first-born son, who is unemployed, so that he may make some income by ferrying people for money.

loans.use: Half of the loan will be used to pay school fees and half to buy plantains and greens to sell.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, reside en compañía  de sus padres  en  una comunidad rural del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira.
José desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de maíz y frijol.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para brindarle un mejor manejo a sus cultivos.
Con el apoyo financiero obtenido él espera aumentar su producción y utilizar sus ganancias en la manutención de sus padres.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a rural community in the town of Gracias, Department of Lempira. He has engaged in farm work from a very young age, specifically the cultivation of corn and beans.

José is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL. He plans to invest the money in the purchase of fertilizers. José will also pay for labor so that he can better manage his crops.

With the financial assistance he will receive, José hopes to increase his production and use the profits to support his parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Enhtugs

texts.en: Mrs. Enhtugs is 44 years old and lives with her daughter in a small house in a ger district of Sukhbaatar district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her older daughter, Javhlan, age 22, works in South Korea by contract worker. Her youngest daughter, Saruuljavhlan, age 20, studies at university. Mrs. Enhtugs has been providing tailoring services since 2009. She has taught her daughter sewing and tailoring. She has built strong relationships with her customers and already stabilized her business. She is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase new Japanese sewing machine and inventory for her business in order to cover her daughter's university expenses. She is well-behaved and a responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase new Japanese sewing machine and inventory for her business

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa esta casada, tiene 35 años de edad, cursó los años de educacion primaria, aun no tiene hijos, se dedica qa la crianza de animales domésticos, específicamente la crianza de pollos, gallinas y chompipes, inicio este negocios con la crianza de pollitos de granja, hasta ahora lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de pollos de engorde, espera en el futuro tener, una granja grande, y así al venderlo tener buena ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía, bordados, tejido, venta de leña, confección de blusas, y a la crianza de animales
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old,  married and has no children yet. She has a primary school education. She raises farm animals, specifically chickens, hens and turkeys. She started this business raising free range chicks, and so far has 15 years experience.

She is organizing the group and applying for a loan, which she will use to buy chickens for fattening. She hopes in the future to have a large chicken operation, and good earnings when she sells.  

The other members of the group work in handicrafts, embroidery, weaving, selling firewood, making blouses and raising animals.

loans.use: To buy farm animals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 61 años es una mujer amable. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijas: Rosa maría y Marisa a quienes cuida en su casa propia. Gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio pudo obtener muchos terrenos agrícolas y construir su acogedora casa, donde cuidó de sus hijos, todos ellos son mayores e independientes. Ahora su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus animales, cuenta con 87 cuyes, 4 ovejas y una vaca, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación. Su secreto es sembrar alfalfa, el cual utiliza como alimento. Además acondicionó una habitación de su casa para la venta de comida los fines de semana, ya la conocen sobre todo por los ricos platos que cocina. Además siembra maíz del cuzco en sus terrenos agrícolas, para esta temporada solo utilizó una parcela, pues las demás los alquilo a buen precio. Hoy en día espera obtener una buena cosecha, ya que trabajó mucho en su cuidado. Ahora desea incrementar su ganado, ya que hace poco vendió un promedio de 300 cuyes y para la próxima temporada tiene que abastecer su ganado para la venta.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Francisca de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos de alfalfa, que le servirá para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Francisca, 61 years old, is a pleasant woman. She lives with her two daughters, Rosa María and Marisa, in her own house. Thanks to her work and sacrifice, she was able to obtain many plots of agricultural land and to build her cosy house where she raised her sons, all of whom are fully grown and independent.

Her life currently focuses on raising her animals. She has 87 guinea pigs, four sheep, and a cow, all of which she cares for with dedication. Her secret is planting alfalfa, which she uses as feed. 

Furthermore, she fitted out a room in her house to sell food on the weekends. She is well known for the delicious dishes which she cooks. She also plants Cuzco corn in her fields. She only used one plot this season, because she rented out the rest at a good price. She is hoping for a good harvest, since she worked hard on her land.

Now Francisca would like to increase the quantity of her livestock. She recently sold about 300 guinea pigs, and she needs to stock up for next season's sales.

She is a member of the "San Lorenzo" solidarity group, and this is her twelfth loan with MFP. She is grateful for all of your help, as she will receive the loan which she needs to achieve her goals. She also promises to be punctual in her payments, as the members of her association are responsible and supportive.

Francisca will use this support to invest in the purchase of organic fertilizer to spread among her alfalfa crops, which she will use for animal feed.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal and pork.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-going children and owns a charcoal stall which she has been operating for two years. She also earns some income from selling groceries. 

Josephine learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The primary challenges she faces in her business are a seasonal business climate and the lack of enough capital to expand the business, an issue she feels will be partly solved by this new loan.  

Josephine is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of charcoal and groceries like tomatoes, kale, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of charcoal and groceries like tomatoes, kale, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married businesslady who lives in Kilifi and sells roofing materials commonly referred to as ‘makuti.’ They are made from coconut leaves. These items are preferred for roofing in Kilifi area and at the coast in general, since they insulate from the heat experienced at the coast during the day time. 

Joyce has been running her business for seventeen years. She is married and has seven children.

Joyce was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase more coconut leaves and threads. Her main challenges are high inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers, and a lack of reliable customers, as well as the fluctuating demand for roofing materials. Joyce will save the additional income from this loan and use it to provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut leaves and threads.

loans.name: Magongo

texts.en:
Magongo is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. Magongo is married and has been a mechanic for ten years. He sells spare parts and repairs vehicles.

He learned of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 93,850 KES to purchase additional spare parts for welding work. 

Magongo faces challenges like the high cost of spare parts, but he is determined to carry out his operations well; he believes that this will help him establish his family and provide them with a good education. His future ambition is to open another branch of his mechanic shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for welding work.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and peanuts. Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like softdrinks, grocery and food items to sell in her general store.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like softdrinks, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Juvelyn has been in this business for 9 years. Juvelyn earns more income from electronic re-loading.

Juvelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Salifou

texts.fr: Salifou est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 23 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant âgé de sept mois. il a une autre personne en plus à sa charge. Il mène comme activité la vente de chaussures dans un marché de la ville depuis 01 an déjà.  avec ce crédit, il voudrait acheter des chaussures afin de renforcer son stock de marchandises dans le but d'ouvrir un second point de vente. ce qui lui permettra de vendre davantage et d'avoir un peu plus de bénéfice. il voudrait faire des économies pour organiser son mariage avec la mère de son enfant.
texts.en:
Salifou is a young 23-year-old Cameroonian. He is single and the father of a 7-month-old child. He has one additional dependent. 

He has been selling shoes in a market in the city for a year. With this loan, he would like to buy shoes in order to increase his inventory and open a second point of sale. This will allow him to increase his sales and to have a little more income. 

He would like to save money so that he can plan a wedding with the mother of his child.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Ma. Venessa

texts.en:
Ma.Venessa is a 26-year-old, married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest child is 4, while the youngest is 3 years old. She is engaged in sea weed farming, and she owns a sari-sari (variety) store.And she also sells chicken and meat  barbecue in her community during night time.  She sells items such as sugar, coffee, pouches of cooking oil, vinegar, noodles and canned goods. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase an engine for the motorboat, sea weed seedlings, and more groceries to resell, like sugar, noodles and cooking oil. Ma.Venessa would like to expand her business and establish a big grocery store in the future, to support her family.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the motorboat, sea weed seedlings, and more grocery inventory for her store.

loans.name: Neri

texts.en:
Neri, a 31 year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol, is the father of a 4 year old daughter. He is a farmer and had been growing rice since he was 21. He earns 8,000 a month by farming.

He requested a loan of 8,000 pesos to buy additional rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Neri hopes that he would be successful in his business in order for him to support his family, as well as to save for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy additional rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 23 years old, married and has a child. To make a living, she owns and operates a bicycle transportation service. (A bicycle is a bike with a passenger cab.) She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 1,000 PHP a month. Jovelyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to buy accessories for her bicycle. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her bicycle

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a 63 year old married man and a fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been in the fish vending business for more than 20 years now. He also runs a sari-sari store or convenience store business.
Francisco is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and additional stocks for his store such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods and others.
In the future, Francisco wants to expand his business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and additional stocks for his store such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods and others

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Germana is a 70 year old married woman and is engaged in nipa (native palm) weaving. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She has seven grown up children.
Germana has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Nipa is valued as an alternative for house roof.
Germana is asking for a loan to buy more nipa to weave and sell. With this, she will be able to augment her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to weave and sell

loans.name: Jesielle

texts.en: Jesielle's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn and coconuts for sale. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. She is from Malibangcao, Clarin and been farming for six years, earning an income of 4,000 PHP a month. This year, Jesielle joined GDMPC. Jesielle is requesting a loan of 5,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been running a 'sari-sari' or variety store business for more than 5 years now.

Ma. Emma has hopes of expanding her business and that is why she joined CEVI to access the financial services offered by the organization through loans. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as sodas, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and others.

Ma. Emma is hopeful that this loan can help her in realizing her dreams of an improved life.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as sodas, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and others

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married and has five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Luzminda owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting rice to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer for their farm. 

Luzminda has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she plans to buy a lot in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for their farm

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a 43-year-old married woman from Villa Aurora, Antequera, Bohol. She is the mother of two children. Nonita has been engaged in basket weaving for 10 years now. This is the source of Nonita’s income to help her husband support their family's expenses and needs. Basket weaving is one of the lucrative business in the country especially in their place. Basket weaving is done using bamboo straw and other materials
Nonita is requesting a loan to buy materials for basket weaving such as bamboo, reeds, vines and others. In the future, Nonita hopes to expand her business in order to augment her income, so that she can continue to provide support for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving such as bamboo, reeds, vines and others

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 55-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a sari-sari store (a variety store) business for more than ten years now selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area.
This business is the source of income for the sustenance of their daily needs and expenses. Luzviminda is is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, toiletries and others. Through this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers and customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, toiletries and others

loans.name: Hariet

texts.en:
Hariet lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya.  She is a married mother of one child and runs a clothing business which she has been operating for four months.  She also works as a hawker (vendor) where she mainly sells pampers.  She learned about Milango through friends, who invited her to the group, and she joined in order to access credit to improve her business operations.  Her main challenges are exhaustion from walking and bad debts.  

Hariet is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase additional pampers to resell.  Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help open a stall in the town.  Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: to purchase additional pampers to sell.

loans.name: Taumaloto

texts.en: Taumaloto is 61 years old and married with 10 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, a frying pan, baking powder and a stove. In the future, Taumaloto hopes to continue to do business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to open a pancake business.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Reina, de 53 años, vive con sus nietos en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de Nacaome, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 25 años al negocio de venta de comida su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Nacaome, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le transitan por el punto de buses donde ella tiene su negocio
Doña Reina esta solicitando 8,000.00 lempiras para compra de Carne de Res, carne de cerdo, repollos, frijoles, carbón, condimentos, servilletas, verduras y queso, de esta forma tener producto para hacer sus comidas y obtener mejores ganancias. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio.
Doña Reina su sueño es mejorar su casa de habitación.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en: Reina, 53, lives with her grandchildren in a house in the community of Nacaome, South part of Honduras, for 25 years she's had a food selling business, her business is located in the local market of Nacaome, her clients are neighbors and friends that every day walk by the bus stop area where she has her business.  Reina is requesting $8,000 lempiras to buy beef, pork, cabbage, beans, charcoal, condiments, napkins, vegetables and cheese; this way she will have the ingredients she needs to make food and make more profit.  With the help from this loan she hopes to satisfy the financial needs of her business.  Reina's dream is to make betterments to her house.  San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2012.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, cabbage, beans, charcoal, condiments, napkins, vegetables and cheese for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, necesita un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer la maquinaria de coser, dándoles mantenimiento para que estén aptas para atender la demanda de costura, este préstamo le servirá para que su sastrería este funcionando bien.
Con el préstamo anterior ayudo a mejorar la vivienda, en el negocio con las ganancias provenientes del trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Maria needs a new loan to fix her sewing machine so that she can maintain its quality thus being able to attend to the demands of tailoring.  This loan will serve as a way for her machine to function well.  Her previous loan helped improve her lifestyle.  She has been able to help her family with her work revenue.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her sewing machines.

loans.name: Rafael Amilcar

texts.es:
Rafael, necesita comprar otro frisser para el negocio de hieleria, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le permita realizar la compra en beneficio del negocio, así tendrá más capacidad para la fabricación de hielo.
Comenta que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo al negocio, ha notado su mejoría en la capacidad  la inversion y en los ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: Rafael needs to buy another freezer for his ice-making business, that's why he requests a new loan to allow him to make the purchase in benefit of his business, this way he will have more capacity to make ice.  He indicates that the previous loan had a positive effect in his business; he has noted the improvement in the capacity, investment and income that he brings home.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to make ice.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a single mom and the owner of Claytime Ceramics, a small arts studio located near Ocean Beach in San Diego. Claytime Ceramics offers hands-on experiences in ceramics painting, mosaic, pottery and clay modeling. Whether alone, in groups or on a romantic date, Caroline’s customers come from all over San Diego to spend a few hours exploring their creativity. Originally from Pakistan, Caroline received a degree in Arts and a Masters in Education. She established her business to provide a creative outlet for the community. She organizes a variety of classes for kids and adults, as well as summer camps that combine time on the beach with indoor arts classes. Furthermore, she collaborates with local schools for fundraisers. Caroline has been running Claytime Ceramics for 10 years and has gone through some difficult periods. After her husband died in 2006, she fought to keep her business going through the recent economic downturn, all while having to take care of two small boys without any other support. Her $6,000 Kiva loan will allow Caroline to update her website, purchase a new kiln and stock her art supplies, especially for her popular mosaic classes. Despite her challenges, Caroline has found her passion and is determined to succeed, daily living out her personal motto: "Do what you love and you'll never work a day!" Find Claytime Ceramics on the web at: www.claytime-ceramics.com.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Caroline from United States

loans.use: to update her website, purchase a new kiln and stock her art supplies

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en:
Fareed is a 46-year-old man. He is the married father of two sons and two daughters.

For the past six years, Fareed has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family. However, the job requires money to cover a variety of costs from time to time. 

Fareed is requesting a 1000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi he drives. This will allow the taxi to move from one area to another legally and enable Fareed to take additional internal and external requests and work extra hours, which will improve his family's income.

In the picture, you can see Fareed with his taxi.

loans.use: to insure and license his taxi.

loans.name: Talaimanu

texts.en: Talaimanu is a 44-year-old woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Talaimanu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, veggie oil, etc. She plans to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. Talaimanu has been a member of SPBD for four years.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, veggie oil, baking powder, an oven, etc.

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DJROMAHUTON est formé de quinze personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ayaba Jeannette, âgée de 44 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo, elle est mariée à un certain Gualbert. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ayaba Jeannette, et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Ayaba Jeannette a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de vingt ans que Ayaba Jeannette exerce comme activité, la vente des produits divers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Ayaba Jeannette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Ayaba Jeannette désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Ayaba Jeannette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DJROMAHUTON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Djromahuton Group is made up of fifteen members who live in the same district. The representative of the group is named Ayaba Jeannette and is shown in the photo with her hand raised. She a married woman who is 44 years of age, and her husband's name is Gualbert. The couple has four children, all of whom attend school and who are their dependents. Ayaba Jeannette and her husband live with their children. Together they pay for all of the various household expenses.

Ayaba Jeannette was able to attend school through the secondary level. For nearly the past twenty years, Ayaba Jeannette has been running her business selling various products from her home. This allows her to pay for the daily needs of her family without too much difficulty. Ayaba Jeannette purchases her merchandise from a market in Benin.

Ayaba Jeannette would like to expand her business so that she can better meet customer demand. To do this, Ayaba Jeannette, together with the other members of the Djromahuton Group, are requesting their first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramón, quiere realizar una compra de zapatos y sandalias para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita la compra de mercadería en variedad de zapatos para adultos y niños, sandalias y chancletas para la época.
El considera que el préstamo que ocupo anteriormente le ayudo a comprarse más pares de zapatos para la venta, hasta el momento su movimiento ha mejorado, en su familia se han mantenido estables, adquirido algunos mejoras para la vivienda, y sigue con su aspiración de tener un local propio.
texts.en: Ramón wants to buy shoes and sandals, for which he requests a loan that will allow him to buy merchandise and a variety of shoes for adults and children, sandals and flip-flops for the season.  He believes that the previous loan helped him buy more shoes for sale, so far the activity has improved, his family is stable, he has made a few betterments to the house and continues to have his aspiration to have his own store.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes for the season.

loans.name: Laufofoga

texts.en: Laufofoga is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables, taro, yams and tamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Laufofoga has requested a loan to buy weed killers, spades, fertilizers, chemicals for snail removal and a mist blower. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2009. With her profits, Laufofoga hopes to improve her business to help her family and further her kids’ educations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers,weed killers, chemicals for snail removal and a mist blower for use at her small plantation

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Susitina has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals, weed spray, weed killer, bush knives, baby taros and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Susitina hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a shovel, wheelbarrow and weed killer.

loans.name: Teiane

texts.en: Teiane is 30 years old and married with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Teiane needs a loan to buy knives, a knapsack sprayer, a chainsaw, wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Teiane will use the profits from her sales to expand her house.

loans.use: to buy knives, a chainsaw, a knapsack sprayer, wheelbarrow etc., for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en: Selepa is 21 years old and married, with one child. She wants to start a small business growing and selling cabbages, tomatoes and beans in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy seeds, a wheelbarrow, rake, knives, gloves, etc. In the future, Selepa hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a wheelbarrow, rake, knives, gloves, etc., to start a farming business.

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en: Valasi is a 59-year-old married woman with ten children. She sells taro, bananas and yams in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Valasi needs a loan to buy new chemicals, knives, an ax, a chainsaw, a wheelbarrow, etc., for her business. She plans to use her profits to expand her house. Valasi has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, knapsack sprayer, ax, knives, wheelbarrow, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 41-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows kava to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Malia has requested a loan to buy kava plants, plastic bags, a shovel and a wheelbarrow. She just became a member of SPDB this year. With her profits, Malia hopes to help with her family's weekly financial needs.

loans.use: to buy kava plants, plastic bags, a shovel, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a separated 61-year-old with six children. To make a living, Paulita operates a general store. Paulita has been engaged in this business for 3 years and earns 12,000 PHP per month from these activities. Paulita is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which she will use to buy products such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, and soap. In 2010, Paulita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc. Rowena has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Sida Group

texts.fr:
Mme PAULINE  est responsable du  groupe SIDA.  Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Un (01) va à l’école et elle a deux (02) personnes  en charge.

Mme vend des céréales depuis 4ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont des hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter  01 sac d'haricot,  01 sac  de maïs et 01 sac de petits mil et un demi-sacs d’arachide. 

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne agrandir son commerce (prendre des tonnes de céréales), et aider son mari pour les charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline is the representative of the Sida Group. She is married and the mother to two children, aged nine and five years old. The oldest attends school, and both are her dependents.

Pauline is doing very well, and has been a grain merchant for the past four years. She purchases her supplies from nearby villages, and her clientele is made up of both men and women. With her loan, Pauline plans to buy one sack each of beans, corn, and pearl millet, and half a sack of peanuts. Pauline hopes to expand her business using the income she is able to save. She plans to purchase her grain by the ton, which will increase her income. Pauline also helps her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of beans, one sack of corn, one sack of pearl millet, and half a sack of peanuts.

loans.name: El Agro De Maria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta conformado por tres personas que desean salir adelante a base del amor, la union familiar y de sacrificio en el trabajo.

La Sra Maria es la presidenta, una mujer que se define con un caracter fuerte, responsable, honrada y muy trabajadora y con infinito amor hacia su hijo, es por estas virtudes que se a ganado en aprecio de sus vecinos y el amor incondicional de su familia viendo en ella un ejemplo a seguir.

El credito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a utilizar en la compra de semilla de papa y tambien para la compra de animales como los cuyes y los pollos de campo y lograr poder diversificar sus productos y con esto obtener mejores ingresos para cada una de sus familias. 

El sueño que la Sra Maria es comprarse un terreno mas grande, donde pueda seguir con su trabajo de agricultura y de animalitos como cuyes y pollos y con esto mantener unida a su familia que para ella es lo mas importante, mejorar sus ingresos y darle la educacion universitaria a su hijo para que logre ser todo un profesional.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three people that wish to get ahead based on love, family unity and sacrifice through hard work.

Maria is the president, a woman that defines herself with strong character, responsible, honest and very hardworking; and with an infinite love for her son; it is because of this virtues that she has earned the respect from her neighbors and the unconditional love from her family who see in her a role model.

The loan requested to Fodemi is going to be used in buying potato seed and livestock such as guinea pigs and farm chickens; this way they will be able to diversify the products and obtain more income for each of their families.

Maria's dream is to buy a larger piece of land where she can continue to work in agriculture and livestock like guinea pigs and chickens, and this way keep her family united which is the most important thing for her; as well as improve her income and help her son get a university degree so he can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy potato seed, guinea pigs and farm chickens.

loans.name: Tautalagia

texts.en: Tautalagia is 65 years old and married with seven children. She wants to start a small business making and selling fans, bags and necklaces in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy knives, a chainsaw and wheel barrow. In the future, she hopes to pay her children’s school fees. She joined South Pacific Business Development in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials such as ribbons, needles, knives, a chainsaw and wheel barrow.

loans.name: Faafulu

texts.en: Faafulu is a 75-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to start growing taro, tamu and yams to earn a living. Faafulu has requested a loan to buy knives, a weed sprayer, ax, wheelbarrow and other farming supplies. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development for three years. Faafulu will spend her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, knapsack sprayer, ax, wheelbarrow and other farming supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. Toafa has requested a loan to buy knives, a weed sprayer, a chainsaw and a wheelbarrow.

She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Toafa will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, a weed sprayer, a chainsaw and a wheelbarrow for her business.

loans.name: Meaalofa

texts.en: Meaalofa  is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small farm and grows taro, taamu and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Meaalofa has requested a loan to buy new weed killer, weed spray, fertilizer, spades and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Meaalofa hopes to improve her business to help with her children's educations and her family matters.

loans.use: to buy new weed killer, weed spray, fertilizer, spades and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Samalaulu

texts.en: Samalaulu  is a 46-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small farm and grows bananas, taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Samalaulu has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, weed killers, weed spray, bush knives, fertilizer and baby taros. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits,Samalaulu hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids educations.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, weed killers, weed spray, bush knives, fertilizer and baby taros.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small farm and grows cabbages, tomatoes, green beans and green peppers to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Sina has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a pair of hoses, a pair of gloves, baby cabbages and baby green peppers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Sina hopes to improve her vegetable gardens to help her family, as well as her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a pair of hoses, a pair of gloves, baby cabbages and baby green peppers for her business.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mr.Otgonbayar is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in small apartment in Selenge Province, Mongolia. His wife Tsatsral is a pediatrician at the province's central hospital. His 2 children, Temuujin (19) and Tuvshinbayar (13), are university and secondary school students. He has worked at a retail stall selling shoes since 2008 and he has obtained lot of experience about which suppliers, customers and products he needs to focus more on. He is now planning to open his own shoe store in a local market. He is requesting a loan of 3500000 MNT to purchase his initial inventory from Erlian, China. He is a diligent, well-behaved and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase his initial shoe inventory from Erlian, China

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 45 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Sto. Niño, where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by selling home and used products. She makes 6,000 PHP a month and is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Susan joined GDMPC last 2010 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Beverlyn has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Beverlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.
