loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Dukore I Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe  Dukore I et habite à Gitega. Il a 34 ans et est marié à Nadine, une cultivatrice.  Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge une jeune fille.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique  de riz et de haricot depuis  15 ans. 

Il  est à son dix-septième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  des engrais chimiques, à revendre comme un nouveau produit,pour gagner plus.
 
Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une maison en ville parce qu’il  espère réaliser de grands  profits.
texts.en:
Jean lives in Gitega and is a member of the Dukore I Group. He is 34 years old and is married to his wife Nadine, a farmer. Together they have three children, two of whom attend school. John also has another young girl as his dependent.

Jean has been selling rice and beans in his shop for the past 15 years. He is currently on his seventeenth loan with Turame. With the loan he receives from Kiva, Jean plans to increase his capital and purchase chemical fertilizers. These he will resell to earn additional income.
 
In the coming years, Jean would like build a house in town as he hopes to earn a large income.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase chemical fertilizers for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca, necesita mejorar su negocio de tienda, solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, ladrillo y lamina, para mejorar el local donde vende los helados, este financiamiento le permitirá tener en mejores condiciones y una nueva apariencia.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que debido a la inversión sus ventas han sido mejor, logrando hacerse de nuevos recursos para la venta, en su hogar su situación económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Blanca needs to improve her store. She is asking for a loan to buy cement, bricks and sheet metal to make improvements to the shop where she sells ice cream. This loan will allow her to have better conditions and a new look.

She thinks that due to the previous loan her sales have been better, giving her new resources. Her financial situation at home has also improved.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sheet metal.

loans.name: Rita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rita, vive con su familia, su esposo y un hijo de 23 años de edad, ella se dedica a la fabricación de puros, este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, lo hace todos los días desde las 7:00am hasta las 6:00pm, no tiene ninguna dificultad y su ventaja es que trabaja desde su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para la elaboración de los puros, como son las hierbas y la hoja del tabaco, canela, entre otras cosas que son parte del preparativo, esta inversión le ayudara a que no descuide  su trabajo y a que no se quede sin producto.
La aspiración de Rita con el negocio es que se le permita  realizarle mejoras a la vivienda y tener una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en: Rita lives with her family; her husband and 23-year-old son, she makes cigars; she learned this activity from her family, she works every day from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM, it's not hard and her advantage is that she can work from home.  She requests a loan to buy materials to make cigars such as herbs and tobacco leaves, cinnamon and other items that are part of the product.  This investment will help her stay focus on her work and avoid that she sells out.  Rita aspires that the business will allow her to afford betterments for her house and to have more stability.

loans.use: to buy herbs to make cigars.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria, vive en casa propia con sus hijos y una hermana, administra una tienda de productos domesticos, además es empleada, este negocio lo suspendió hace un año, pero lo reinicio hace seis meses, hoy en dia esta vigente y por eso quiere invertirle.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de azúcar, maíz, frijol, boquitas, galletas y otros productos para la tienda, que le sean utiles para mejorar la capacidad y mejorar las ventas.
Su objetivo con el negocio es crecerlo, que este bien surtido, que sea mas rentable.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home with her children and her sister. She runs a food store and also works as a domestic employee. She suspended her business a year ago, but restarted it 6 months later. It's currently operating and so she wants to invest in it.

She asks for a loan to buy sugar, corn, beans, snacks, cookies and other products for her store - things that will be useful to improve her capacity and her sales.

Her goal is to grow her business, keep it well-stocked and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, beans, snacks, cookies.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small farm and grows taro, taamu and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tumema has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, fertilizer, weed killer, weed spray and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Tumema hopes to improves her business to help her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, fertilizer, weed killer, weed spray and a mist blower.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 25-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Josephine needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, a large cooking pot for gas ovens. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family matters. Josephine has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and has five children; four children are in school.

Josie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Josie has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. 

Ma. Chona runs a retail business, where she sells clothing and kitchen utensils to the community in her place. She has been in this business for more than 20 years now. She and her husband work together in their business.

Ma. Chona is asking for a loan to buy additional goods like t-shirts, pants and shorts for resale. With this loan, she will be able to improve her store and attract more customers and buyers, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like t-shirts, pants and shorts for resale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lorna is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her frozen products buying and selling business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains and a general store business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains and additional groceries to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains and additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Barbara is 49 years old and has no children who are in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Barbara has been in this business for five years.

Barbara requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, eggs, canned goods, etc. In the future, Barbara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 47 years old, separated, with five children. She lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran. For the last 21 years, she has been running a general store to make a living. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the store operations.

In 2009, Merlyn joined GDMPC. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand the business and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of cocoyams, some plantains, and two sacks of smoked fish.

loans.name: Malaika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Malaika, avec quarantaine  d’âge, mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’entraide avec son conjoint. Furaha est vendeuse de braises, elle dispose son propre entrepôt de braises. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il y a plus d'une décennie, elle exerce cette activité économique. Elle vient de réaliser 17 cycles de crédit  avec l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises (quelques  sacs des braises). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et voir ses enfants finir leurs études. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées à l'entreprenariat féminin.
texts.en:
Furaha is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Malaika business group. She is forty years old, married, and the mother of six children. She supports them together with her spouse.

Furaha is a charcoal merchant, and she has her own charcoal warehouse. She started her business with the help of funds from her husband. She has now been running her business for over a decade. She just completed her seventeenth loan cycle with IMF Hekima.

Her current loan will serve to supply Furaha with new merchandise (several sacks of charcoal). In addition, Furaha's aim is to expand her business and see her children finish school. She thanks Hekima for their dedication to female entrepreneurship.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of chacoal.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 61 años de edad, tiene seis hijos mayores de 18 años, vive en casa propia, realiza el cultivo de  granos básico desde que estaba pequeño junto a su padre, desde hace 10 años lo realiza para su familia y los hijos le ayudan.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de 8 sacos de abono y herbicidas, con esto tendrá la oportunidad de aplicar lo necesario a su siembra para crear la posibilidad de que su cosecha sea abundante, Este préstamo le dará el dinero que será útil para su trabajo.
Su objetivo es invertir en la agricultura para mejorar económicamente con su familia, dándoles a sus hijos la oportunidad de que puedan estudiar y tener una buena alimentación.
texts.en:
José grows corn and beans, he is 61-years-old, has six children with more than 18 years of age, he lives in his own house and has worked in agriculture growing basic grain crops since he was little with his father; 10 years ago he does it for his family and his children help him.  He requests a loan to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer and herbicides, this will give him the opportunity to apply what's needed for his crop and increase the possibility to have a good harvest.  This loan will provide the money that will be used to do his work.
His goal is to invest in agriculture to improve to improve the economy in his family, give his children the opportunity to study and be well-fed.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer and herbicides.
